All Reviews

  1. Great shave. Wish the refills were cheaper. Not sure if the vibration works, but I still use it.
  2. Great grip! The mircopulses help create a smooth shave that does not irritate the skin. I was also shocked with how light the device is. I did get the product for free.
  3. The product was provided free through a program run by Gillette<br /><br />The Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power handle is a great product. Nice clean shave and fits comfortable in the hand to give a great shaving experience
  4. I received a sample Proglide Power System handle and blade from Gillette to try out. I have used a variety of shaving systems, but generally prefer Gillette. This new system with a power blade works very well. The handle is balanced and easy to grip, and you need to get used to holding it a bit differently because of the system vibration. Very nice, close, painless shave.
  5. I received the Fusion ProGlide Power razor and handle for free through a Gillette program. The handle is comfortable and sturdy. The rubber enhancements work well. The handle is balanced and easy to grip, and you need to get used to holding it a bit differently because of the vibration. Very well designed!
  6. I tried the new Gillette Fusion ProGlide razor recently because I got it free through a promotion from Gillette. I found it to be a great product and provide a very smooth shave. The handle was very comfortable and easy to maneuver and it really gives a great shave. The only downside would be that it's an expensive proposition on a regular-purchase basis. That, of course, doesn't take anything away from the quality of the product...just a matter of priorities when shopping! Thanks Gillette...
  7. I got this razor through a program run by gillette, it is a great handle, comfortable and nimble enough to shave at any angle. It is also weighted just right so that it provides a comfortable, close shave.
  8. I've used the Schick Hydro and MAC3 razors in the past. I noticed that Gillette was running a program for a free razor and I wanted to test it out.<br /><br />The biggest plus I saw with the Proglide was that the handle was battery operated. Therefore, it should work very similar to a electric razor. There is a push button on the front of the handle that allows for the razor to work electrically. In addition, you just need to turn the bottom of the handle to open the part where the battery is stored. A very simple process if you need to change it.<br /><br />The handle was very enjoyable to hold. As most razors are, this handle was made rubber. I found the grip to be very good.<br /><br />I really enjoyed the design of this handle, however I still felt some tug on the overall shave on my face. The thicker haired area of my face saw the all the tug (5-6 times around my chin). However, other areas that were not as thick felt a very smooth and close shave. In addition, clean up only took a few seconds.<br /><br />I would highly recommend this to the individual with limitied to medium thickness of facial hair. I rated this 4/5 because it might not be the best option if you have very thick facial hair.
  9. I am used to the Mach3 Turbo, with its relatively thin handle. I shave in the shower and found the handle to be a little difficult to handle. Between the vibration and the soap, it sometimes felt as though I was going to drop the razor. I will continue using it and see if it is just a matter of getting used to it.
  10. When I first saw the Fusion ProGlide Power handle, I have to admit I thought it was just a marketing gimmick that would be used to up prices.<br /><br />But I was suprised, it complements the Proglide blades and provides for a much smoother shave and experience than I'm used to.<br /><br />I received the handle/razor free as part of a program run by Gillette.
  11. I recently received a free sample of this razor from a Gillete promotion. Usually with these disposable razors the weight and feel of the handle itself is a bit on the light side. Most of the time this is because it is a hollow plastic, as a result I always need to grip tighter to get the right sort of control and pressure I want on the blade. With this razor however, there are two differentiating factors that negate this issue. The first is the riveted handle itself. The grooves within it allow for a more natural and less forced grip on the razor. The second is that because this is a battery operated razor, and that battery is housed in the handle, you get that extra weight that is sorely missing from other disposables. The difference is clear and can be compared to holding a full tang chef's knife against holding a wood handled discount knife. The weight and grip, give control of the razor at a more nuanced degree than any other disposable I have tried.
  12. I love the micropulses handle with the side grips! Even when I get it wet it stays firmly in my hand! Best razor ever and thank you Gillette for giving it free! Now I will be a loyal customer
  13. Gillette has excellent products and I'm glad I got in on their promotion to try the razor and blades for free. I'm a fan of the blades and handle to a point. I like the close shave, control and feel of the handle. I don't care for the power feature as I felt I'd likely cut my chin using it there. I'll continue to use only without the battery. The non power version is on my list to try next.
  14. It is great for sensitive skin, no cuts or irritations. It is modern and easy to use, nice handle, great blades. It looks and feels great when using it, better than previous Gillette products. I am glad I was able to try it for free from Gillette.
  15. Awesome product. I was more than happy to accept this razor from the program by Gillette. The battery last forever and the bottom line is that the razor provides a great shave for a low cost. Before this razor I was using disposables and was going through them after 2-3 shaves. I feel like I get a better shave with this razor without no nicks. Great product.
  16. My Mach 3 Turbo Power shave handle is getting a little long in the tooth. I've probably used it for well over 5 years but it has always done a good job, felt solid in my hand and worked exactly like you'd hope a razor handle to. When I got the chance to try out the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power handle as part of a free program from Gillette, I was pretty happy to try it out.<br /><br />When I got the razor handle, I took it out of the package and got a feel for it. I even sat and compared it to my Mach 3 Turbo Power handle (which, even at 5 years old, still looks exactly the same as the new Mach 3 Power handles, so I think the comparisons can hold up). The Fusion ProGlide Power handle was bigger in size and circumference, a tad lighter and had more tacky rubber to the handle than the Mach 3 Power handle. I can't say one is better than the other, but they are both nice and solid and they feel good in the hand.<br /><br />I think the Fusion ProGlide Power handle looks quite a bit better than the Mach 3, but I don't think the cosmetics of either product have a positive or negative impact on their functions. The Fusion ProGlide Power handle kind of reminds me of Terminator and Robocop all rolled into one and thus, I feel like one bad dude when I use it. Further speaking to the cosmetic appeal of the Fusion ProGlide Power handle, the power button actually lights up a cool blue which is nothing more than pretty, but I like pretty.<br /><br />Before using, I placed both razors on a flat surface and turned their power on, which is a slight vibration that is supposed to aid in removing hair for the areas you shave. Both had fresh batteries for comparison's sake. The Fusion ProGlide Power handle jumped around the table like it was auditioning for So You Think You Can Dance. The Mach 3 blade moved around, but not quite as much. That could be a result of years of use or the Fusion Power has that much more vibe, it's hard to tell.<br /><br />Once I got to use the Fusion ProGlide Power handle to shave, I liked it quite a bit. It continued to feel nice in the hand as I shaved my face and head. One thing that was slightly odd to me was that it felt a bit slippery when it got a lot of water on it. I wasn't expecting that due to all the rubber on the handle, but it was more slippery than my other razor handle. By no means a deal breaker, it wasn't flying out of my hand or anything. It was just a bit slicker than I expected with water on the handle.<br /><br />By the time I was done shaving, I was pretty happy with the handle overall. It works exactly like you'd want it to, feels nice in the hand and just for a cherry on top, it looks kinda cool, too. I'd gladly recommend the handle to anyone in the market as long as they wanted to go with the 5 blade option.
  17. Loved the razor! It gave a comfortable shave that was effortless. Worth the money, but it is expensive! I would totally recommend it to anyone. A really good razor is hard to find and I think I may have found my favorite
  18. I'll admit up front that I didn't have to pay for this razor. I got it via a program from Gillette. But after using now for a few days, I'm definitely planning on buying a second one for my travel kit. This thing is loaded with great features to have a great shave with, but after getting used to the features at the top of the razor, I've been noticing the past couple shaves how nice the handle is. I'm guessing Gillette did some 'beta testing' or focus groups or something, because the handle is great. It's a bit bigger than what I had before, more suited to a man's hand, and the contour is great. Very comfortable to hold. And, when the power is engaged, you really feel connected to the razor handle. Really nice.
  19. I tried out this razor free as part of a The Gillette Fusion Proglide Power Razor has a nice, solid weight to it, plus bigger, more ergonomic side grips compared to previous versions. I shave in the shower, so having a a razor I can keep a steady grip on even when it's wet is important to me. The thinner blades of the cartridge make for less tug and pull than some other razors; I'm sure the good grips, the swiveling head, and the concomitant enhanced maneuverability likewise contribute to the ease of shaving. I switched to power razors years and years ago--don't know whether the vibration actually helps, but I like the feel! The razor has an automatic turn-off feature as well.
  20. I am so happy that Gillette came up with the first electric slim handle on a razor! All the electric razors I have had in the past have a very thick handle which makes it harder to get in certain areas of my face, this now allows me to do better triming as well. I would recomend this razor to anyone who uses an electrical razor on a regular basis. Now that I have switched I will not go back to any other electric razor! Thank you gillette for the oportunity to try this razor first!
  21. I was provided a free Gillette Fusion ProGlide Razor via a program run by Gillette. The handle seemed to be over designed. I didn't really notice the improved grip, although I guess that is a good thing since I didn't have any problems holding it, even when wet. The large bulb at the bottom was kind of annoying to me and effects the overall aesthetics of the look of the handle, which overall is pretty cool. For many shoppers who make purchases such as these based off the look in the package, such as myself, you might be losing some customers with this bump at the bottom. As for the overall shave, it's great. The powered handle seemed to increase the quality of shave and for someone who doesn't shave very often, experiences like these make me want to shave more.
  22. Gillette has made a quality handle that makes shaving easy. I like the grippiness of the Handle. The micro pulses from the Duracell battery power make for an effortless close comfortable shave.
  23. I received the Fusion Power Proglide from Gillette for free as part of a program they are sponsoring to promote the product, the price was right so even though I am primarily an electric user I gave it a try. It is no doubt a quality product & gives a close shave, but I would not attribute any of that to the vibrating handle. It feels good in your hand but did nothing to enhance my shaving experience. Perhaps if I was a regular blade user it may have had more of an impression on me, but the vibrating thing just struck me as gimmicky.
  24. Love this product for my everyday shave. It got close and lasted long without irritation. I received it free through a promotion and use it everyday. It comes with a nice holder to keep it save from kids and even has a reflective mirror for quick shaves. The battery operated vibrations keep it smooth and comfortable. HIGHLY RECOMMEND
  25. I've been using the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power handle for a few weeks now (I received them as a free demo through Gillette), and I've got mixed feelings about it. While I like the fact that it's thinner and more easily-handled than most of the other powered handles I've used before, I guess I just really don't like the vibration aspect. It seems to take the \\"feel\\" out of the shave - makes my fingers numb. I've got a beard/mustache, and do some precision shaving, and the vibration seems to dull the feel I use to get an accurate line.<br /><br />It does work just fine without being turned on, and is a good enough handle in that case. I prefer a bit more of an angle between the blades and the handle, but this straighter line seems to be where most newer handles are going. But, if you're not going to use the power option, I'd assume there are cheaper options out there that use these same blades (which are great, by the way - super thin, sharp, and smooth).
  26. I was fortunate enough to be able to participate in a program Gillette sponsored for the Fusion Proglide Power razor. Gillette provided me with the power handle and the Fusion Proglide Power cartridge. I have been using their manual Mach3 for many years now and have been very satisfied. I have a tough beard and over the years it has gotten tougher (gray hair, LOL). I have always had my doubts about a razor that vibrates...until now. The combination of the rows of 5 blades and the vibrating handle allows me to shave in a short period of time without having to go back and shave over the same areas. The vibration will take some getting used to, but the Fusion Proglide Power will be replacing my Mach3. That says a lot since I have been using the Mach3 for almost 15 years.
  27. I received the proglide power through a campaign that gillette was running a few weeks ago and have been using it about every third day or so. Coming from it's non power counterpart the size increase to accommodate the battery is a bit strange at first, but I've actually grown to like it now. The handle is no heavier (if not lighter) than the non powered one, but this is because it is now plastic rather than metal. While I would have preferred metal, I doubt I would have like the weight it would have added. Other than that, the new grip design is great, not super tacky, but still enough grip for decent control. The major change in design this make is the micropulse vibrations. When I tested this out initially, my stubble was quite a bit longer than I usually let it get, and the vibrations didn't seem to do a whole lot to me in that situation. Once it regrew out to the usual short stubble, the micropulses actually seemed to help give me a smoother cut. Not entirely sure If I'm completely converted over to this new tech, but for now, I'd be lying if I said I wasn't enjoying it!
  28. I recieved a free sample from Gillete and was skepticsl after using multiblade razors for years. The vibration really does work. Smothest shave i hve ever had. Use it in the shower and it works gret.

This vibrating power handle is really cool!! I normally use an electric razor, but this razor provides a great deal more precision for my shave and the vibration is helpful to make for a more comfortable shave.

  36. I personally don't like shaving. I usually end up cutting my face, or worse, dropping the razor and for some forsaken reason, trying to catch it and cutting a nail. Yes, I have done this on more than one occasion.<br /><br />I was pleasantly surprised to get the Fusion ProGlide and get to try it out. It sounded a little gimmicky - a vibrating handle? It allowed for a great shave, and I didn't even cut myself.<br /><br />Didn't the vibration cause me to drop the razor?   38. I was offered the chance to try the Fusion Proglide Power Razor through a program run by Gillette.   39. I tried the Gillette Fusion Pro Glide Power Razor as part of a promotion run by Gillette. I had been a loyal Schick Xtreme3 user for many many years. Aesthetically, they are day and night. The Gillette is bright blue and chrome and really looks good. The rubber gripping on the top of the handle is perfectly designed. The rubber gripping on the bottom is deep and firm allowing for a light touch to control the handle. ( much like new grips on a golf club make for a better swing) I found the extreme swivel of the cartridge placed the handle at an odd position and sometimes close to 90 degrees to the shaving cartridge. After a week of trial shaving, I couldn't use the power feature any longer. I don't understand the purpose of a vibrating straight razor. When the handle was vibrating, it felt as if I could not control the handle or cartridge. This power feature is not for me. The handle itself, minus the power feature, is designed very very well. I have reviewed the cartridge in a separate review . After two weeks of trail shaving, I must admit that the Gillette is by far the most masculine looking razor I have ever used, however it's not for me. I will continue the search for the perfect razor.
  40. I have used other Gillette products in the recent past and was always pleased so when I got this handle for free to try, I was excited. This handle is so light!   43. I was provided with a Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power razor to try and I was extremely pleased with the results. I keep the razor in my shower and have found that no water has penetrated the battery compartment after the last two weeks. In summary, I have nothing negative to say about this razor and will be switching over to this model going forward.
  44. I was given by Gillette, the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power handle to test. I found the handle to be a great fit for my hands. It has the feel of quality in the weight and balance.   45. First I want to say I've shaved with most razors out there, even the Gillette Mach 3 ,Schick Hydro 5 , and this by far is the best closest ,least irritating shave I have had. I got this from a Gillette program but will be buying the blades. They do cost a little more but I got about twice as many shaves out of them than with others so they were worth it. With this shave there is no pulling or tugging, the blades seem so sharp they just glide over you can cut with out any effort. The blade across the top is actually pretty handy , it shaved close to my nose and made sideburns even and easy. I also love the fact there was no irritation when shaving With this razor and I think it cut my shaving time down due to not having to go back over areas ..I'd give it six stars if there were 6 to choose from.....
  46. First of all, it MUST be noted that Gillette has made a great effort to rethinking plastic blister pack design. Blister packs are HORRIBLY difficult to open, and often result in sharp lacerating edges. The Fusion ProGlide has a perforated zip panel on the back so that ordinary humans can actually get to the product. Love it, love everything about it.<br /><br />That was the first thing that pleased me.<br /><br />As for the razor itself (which was provided free as a Gillette marketing program) after the first use, it looks like a winner. The blades are smaller and thinner than my regular non-power Fusion, and seemed to do a better job of cutting, rather than pulling, at a few days' growth. The vibrating feature of the handle took some getting used to, as it tends to make my hand feel odd. However, it too seemed to aid in the actual cutting process, by shimmying the blades minutely creating a tool that seems part razor, part clippers. The trimming blade also worked well, though I didn't notice a difference between it and my regular Fusion, other than the thinness of the blade.<br /><br />Overall, it does seem to work a bit better than my normal, non-powered Fusion razor. I'm sold.
  47. I received a Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power and I can say, without a doubt, that I've found my new favorite razor. The handle is comfortable and easy to grip.
  48. The first thing I tried after receiving it for free from Gillette was a side-by-side comparision with my Mach 3 razor. So I put a new blade on my old razor and shaved one side of my face and neck, and the other with the Fusion. Without hesitation I can say the Fusion was a much smoother and less iritating shave. However, both razors seemed to give the same shave in terms of closeness. To be sure, I let my hair grow out a few days and there was no appreciable difference. I can recommend this to anyone who needs a very sensitve shave. The battery power works in the shower, so that's a nice convenience. Naturally, with a battery, there's more heft than an unpowered razor like the Mach 3.The downside, you might expect, is that the blades are about twice as expensive as the Mach 3. Since my old razor never bothered me, I won't be switching to these more expensive blades. But if money is no object, or if you really need a more comfortable shave, this would be a good razor for you.
  49. I really liked the shave I got from Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power razor. I was a nice smooth close shave. The vibration really help with not getting any nicks. The handle was big, but something I could get use too. Thank you, Gillette for providing me with my new favorite razor form your free program.

The trimmer was the icing on the cake for me; this thing really got the hard to reach spots under the nose and worked great at the side burns. Before, I had to use a seperate,smaller razor just for those areas, but now I'm happy to say that I finally have my all in one razor!!

  54. I have very sensitive skin and have realized I can usually only shave with razors that have two blades. This is because one blade or 3+ blades usually pull and tug. I then get ingrown hairs and infections, razor burn, and irritation. I was very skeptical of trying this razor, but it definitely does what it says. Receiving this razor to try for free was definitely amazing. This will be my \\"go to\\" razor from now on. This is really an \\"all in one\\" razor for me. In the pst I've had to use multiple razors or devices to achieve my look. Now with the Gillette Fusion ProGlide I can shave, use the mircro comb and the trimmer blade and be done. The razor is also very easy to hold and use, which is a plus. The handle is not too large or too small. It is also not too heavy or light. In the past I have also had issues with the weight and size of a razor handle. If it is not the right size or weight it is not easily maneuvered and the shave is not as good as it could be. Also if it's not the right weight or size it can just be all around hard to shave. This is the perfect razor for me.
  55. This Gillette Fusion was given to me for free through a program run by Gillette. I'm however under no obligation to post positive or negative reviews - just honest feedback.<br /><br />I have a Gillete Fusion (non-battery operated version) that I've used for more than a year now. The result is comparatively equal, with no noticeable difference in smoothness or (lack of) stubble.<br /><br />There was one major difference however. The battery-operated version is much more efficient than its predecessor. In just one swipe, the skin was left extremely smooth and didn't require additional shaving over the same skin. The significance is that anyone with sensitive skin knows that running a razor blade over the same spot that'd been previously shaved over can easily irritate the skin.<br /><br />The packaging was hassle-free and easy to open, requiring no scissors or additional patience to get through a barrier of plastic.<br /><br />I can't comment on how long the battery lasts as I've only used it a few times.<br /><br />The fact that it's waterproof is a huge plus. I shave in the shower and use a mirror that is specifically made to hang on a shower wall with anti-fogging technology. Consequently, I need a razor that can stand up to water. Any time you have a battery-operated tool, you are instantly weary of water penetration.<br /><br />All in all, this is a fantastic razor handle and would be perfect for those with sensitive skin.<br /><br />If you don't already have a fusion razor, I'd suggest buying this pro glide, battery-operated version. If you already have the non-battery razor, then stick with it.<br /><br />I do believe this is the best overall product for shaving on the market. If price isn't an issue and you have sensitive skin then this needs to be in your shaving arsenal.ou don't already have a fusion razor, I'd suggest buying this pro glide, battery-operated version. If you already have the non-battery razor, then stick with it.<br /><br />I do believe this is the best overall product for shaving on the market. When dry, it's got a nice feel to it, but when it got wet, it lost all of it's grip and I found it difficult to hold on to. I've now been careful to only rinse the razor itself, but some water inevitably runs down to the handle. Great shave though - overall, 4 out 5 stars!

  76. While the blades on this free razor I received as part of a Gilette program are top notch, I have to be honest: I have no idea what the vibration is supposed to do. It doesn't make the shave better, in fact it may hurt it slightly, since the last thing you want when shaving is tiny rapid movement of the blades. The vibrations didn't make my stubble stand up on end. It didn't add any smoothness, or anything else for that matter. If anything it was annoying.<br /><br />The one plus with the handle is that it is very easy to grip. The handle has grips that make the razor feel secure in your hand, eliminating the worry about slipping. The power in the handle creates a slight vibration while shaving and seems to help glide the razor over the beard and face. I like he fact that even though the razor contains a battery, it is still safe to use in the shower. An added bonus is that if left on the handle will turn itself off after 8 mins. Overall, I have found the handle design with its grip and vibrations to be a complement to the whole shaving experience.
  102. I tried the Gillete Fusion ProGlide Power I received from Gillette. This razor gives an unbelievably close shave, and it is easy to handle, minimizing razor burn and cuts. I don't always use the power function, as it works fine without it, but it is a nice option to have.
  103. Once Ireceived my free razor from the program run by Gillette, i couldn't wait to give it a try. I was very surpised as this razor was very high powered. I had pretty nice growth on my face and head. This razor went straight through without a problem. Will use this again.
  104. I received a Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power Handle free from a program run by them. The handle was nice and I did like the thicker feel. I gave this three stars since it did produce a nice, clean shave. It just didn't live up to the hype, and therefore not worth the added cost.

  114. I was able to try the Fusion ProGlide Power free from a program run by Gillette. Prior to this I really never put much stock into a power razor, having used Gillette's Mach 3 for a long time and being quite content with it. But since the opportunity came up to give this a shot I figured it was worth trying out.<br /><br />I was immediately impressed with how smooth the shave was and how much closer it felt. The razor has a nice weight and balance and I definitely feel like the electronic pulses, combined with the thinner blades, make it a far better shaving experience than the Mach 3 without any cuts or nicks. Weather using gel, foam or even a sugar-based shaving scrub, the Fusion ProGlide just glides across my face and consistently gives me a very close and comfortable shave.<br /><br />This has become my every day razor, and I especially noticed the difference when I had to travel recently and used a travel Mach 3. It felt almost primitive compared to the Fusion ProGlide Power. Whether shaving with or against the grain, I don't notice any difference in the ease of which it cuts hair and I also find I have no irritation in areas that I previously did.<br /><br />It certainly costs a bit more than other razor, but you're paying for a far superior overall experience and it's well worth the extra money.
  115. I got this razor free from Gillette thanks to a program they were running. This razor seems similar to the regular Gillette Fusion (which is the razor I use), except this one has a AAA battery that makes it vibrate. The vibration makes this Fusion feel a little like an electric razor -- or how I remember an electric razor feeling, because I haven't used one in years. The sensation wasn't particularly pleasant, but would be acceptable, I guess, if the razor was delivering a superior shave. In my experience, though, it doesn't. I don't feel I'm getting a shave that is any better or closer than I get with my regular, non-power Fusion. And the vibration seemed to make me go more slowly. So, this razor isn't really delivering a closer shave, it's taking me longer to shave, and I found the vibration to be annoying. It's not something I intend to use. If any of this seems intriguing to you, though, you may want to try it out.

  127. When I first received the free Gillette Fusion ProGlide via a program by Gillette, I looked at the handle and laughed. It was only before I put the handle in my hands that I realized that I had one of the lightest handles I have ever used. When you first look at the handle and see that is bulky than the original ProGlide razor handle you laugh. The handle itself is larger in the core area (\\"tip to razor attachment area\\") because of where the AAA battery is placed. However with or without the battery, the blade is lighter. I not only could feel the difference in holding it but a scale shows the difference easily. I was truly shocked at how light handle itself is compared to I have been using which is the ProGlide.<br /><br />Using the handle is easy. On the center front of the handle, the power button is located. Its position on the handle easily allows you to trigger the power without needing to feel around the handle for the button. Despite its bulkier width, I found that this handle was more user friendly. At no time did I find myself fighting to figure out how to use it. The handle is truly amazing that in its larger size, it is lighter than any handle I have come in contact with. I have to give this handle five stars as I have been amazed by it in my trial runs. Gillette did an amazing job in the design and features of this handle.
  128. I was provided a Gillete Fusion ProGlide Power handle free of charge to review by a program run by Gillete. The Gillete Fusion ProGlide Power handle has a good feel in your hand. It is not so skinny that you feel like you are going to drop it. Shaving without the handle turned is like any other shave. Turn on the power handle and get ready for the shake. The first couple of shaves I actually had trouble keeping a grip of the razor. I had what I called the ProGlide Shake. After the first couple of shaves, I get use to the vibration the have not had any issues with loosing my grip. You can definitely tell that the overall shave is better with the handle turned on. This handle is a success.

  136. I'll start out saying all razors cause me some pain during the cutting process. These Proglide cartridge are the best of the bunch though.   137. I've tried many different multiple blade razors and electric shavers in the past, but have been exclusively using the Schick Quattro for the last 5 or 6 years. I have not been able to find anything that worked better for me. I have even been able to make the blade cartridges last up to 3 months by keeping it dry after using it and using shave gel instead of the foamy shave cream.<br /><br />A few weeks ago, I received an invite from a program run by Gillette to try their new Fusion Proglide Power Handle Razor. So I signed up and waited and after only a few days, the razor arrived. I opened the brown box that it came in, and saw that it was enclosed in the Adult-Proof plastic that is near impossible to open. Imagine my delight when I turned it over and saw that there was perforations along the back for easy opening!! I quickly opened it and took the razor out. For a razor with disposable cartridges, this one has the look and feel of a non-disposable one.<br /><br />1st Shave (2 days growth)<br />The ProGlide felt smooth in all directions, with and against the grain. No pulling on the neck or under the chin. The trimmer was easy to use. This was a nice feeling. :)<br /><br />2nd Shave (2 days growth)<br />Same as first<br /><br />3rd Shave (3 days growth)<br />Same as before<br /><br />4th Shave and every shave there after<br />It pulled noticeably on the neck, especially against the grain. It left a couple of small \\"razor burn\\" marks on my neck. The lubricating strip was almost gone, whereas the Quattro lasts as long as I use it.<br /><br />It always rinsed clean easily with no clogging.<br /><br />With that said, as much as I really wanted to like this, this razor receives only 2 stars from me for the following reasons:<br /><br />- Blades and lubricating strip do not last nearly as the Quattro.<br />- Although the first few shaves were smooth, I did not receive a closer shave than with the Quattro.<br />- Cost<br />- Five bladed tends to nick my face more often than the Quattro or any other four bladed razor<br /><br />So this is definitely a nay!
  138. I generally use a standard razor with disposable blades because I have experienced irritation when using electric razors in the past. Because of past negative experiences with electric razors I had not been tempted to try any of the battery-operated semi-power razors, but I have been using the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power razor for the past few weeks due to a free program from Gillette to try this new razor.<br /><br />Overall, the handle is larger than the razor I typically use (Mach3), but it is pretty light and I quickly got used to it and it did not feel awkward in my hand or during my shave. The blade head is much larger than I am used to due to the 5 blades. While this made shaving my neck and most of my face quicker and easier, the larger head made shaving more \\"precision\\" areas like my upper lip and chin a little difficult as I felt like the razor was not able to contour easily to the chin fold or part of the upper lip just below the nose.<br /><br />I used the razor both with the power on and off. While the slight vibration while shaving with the razor power on was pleasant, I did not notice a major difference in the closeness of the shave I got while using the razor with the power off. With the power on though, I did not experience the same irritation that I have in the past when using full electric razors.<br /><br />I have been happy in the past with other Gillette products that I use, and I would recommend this razor to friends who were curious in trying it. It's a little pricier than non-power options, but for me it seems a better value than buying a full electric razor. I am taking one star off my review due to the slight difficulty of shaving precision areas with the large blade head.

  140. Please note that I received this handle for free via a program run by Gillette. However, the following review is not sponsored by anyone and is solely my opinion.<br /><br />I am a lazy person when it comes to shaving. I counteract this by using a Norelco SensoTouch 3D electric razor. But there are moments, meetings, social events, and my wife's request for a closer shave that no electric razor can accomplish. For those shaves, I must use a manual razor.<br /><br />The Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power handle will be my handle of choice, since it is such a great transition handle from my electric razor. It provides me real razor blades with vibration for a less painful shave.<br /><br />I wanted to use this handle for a few weeks before writing a review. Here are my conclusions:<br /><br />Vibration: I was excited by this. Using an electric razor, I am used to not feeling anything, no snag or tug. I was hoping that the vibration would reduce what I felt when using a manual razor. So what I did was use the vibration on half my face and not use it on the other half. Each time I did I could feel a significant increase in my shaving comfort with the vibration on. I also tested the quality of my shave (I had my wife rub her hands on my cheek) and there was no difference. I really enjoy the vibration feature.<br /><br />The feel: The handle fits my hand comfortably and is simple to use.<br /><br />Quick release: This is a common feature but it works.<br /><br />Storage: I enjoy the simple plastic holder that comes with the handle. It could even be considered elegant among other grooming supplies.<br /><br />The fact that the battery comes with the package: Thank you Gillette for actually having some consideration that your customers don't have a stash of AAA batteries at home. Very convenient.<br /><br />Overall, I highly recommend this product. I will still be an electric razor user 90% of the time, but for that 10%, this handle will help me achieve the close shave.
  141. I am typically an electric razor user. I hate nicks and the feeling of razor burn... plus I am not a big fan of the mess of the shaving cream and the stubble a razor leaves in the sink. Nope! Not at all. I tried the Fusion ProGlide without the handle vibrating and the shave was everything I hate about blade razors. I had less irritation with the ProGlide than the electric. \\"Glide\\" indeed!<br /><br />If you are looking to get back into the bladed razor world. I recommend the Fusion ProGlide.   148. I received a free Gillette ProGlide Fusion Power razor in connection with a promotional program sponsored by Gillette. I've used Gillette shaving products almost exclusively since the original Sensor debuted in the early 1990s, so I was eager to try Gillette's latest shaving system.<br /><br />The ProGlide Fusion Power features a large handle, a five-blade cartridge, and a battery-powered motor that produces \\"micropulses\\" (vibrations) during shaving. I found the handle comfortable to hold, though I suspect its size has more to do with the need to accommodate an AAA battery than with ergonomic design considerations. I found the five-blade cartridge a little too large for shaving comfortably around the mouth and under the nose (the razor includes a \\"precision trimmer\\" that's intended to solve this problem, but I found it difficult to maneuver precisely enough to achieve the desired results). I didn't find the \\"micropulse technology\\" unpleasant in any way, but neither did I find that it discernibly enhanced the quality of my shave.<br /><br />Don't get me wrong--the ProGlide Fusion Power delivered a very close, very comfortable shave...but I don't think it outperformed the Gillette Mach3 Turbo razor that I've been using for the better part of ten years. That razor delivers an equally close and equally comfortable shave, and it does it at a lower cost--the replacement cartridges are less expensive, and it doesn't require batteries.<br /><br />The ProGlide Fusion Power is a perfectly fine product, and I wouldn't discourage anyone from buying it. But, for me, the improvements in Gillette's latest-generation shaving system aren't compelling enough to make me switch.
  149. My Gillette Fusion Proglide experience has been nothing less than spectacular. My skin is smooth, I don't have to worry about hiding out due to blemishes, and I owe it to Gillette and their Fusion Proglide Power Handle!

The handle is light and fits well in my handle and provides a secure grip so that it doesn't slip. I would highly recommend this product! This razor was free from a Gillette promotion.<br />The blades on this razor a OUTSTANDING. I purposely waited to let my stubble go for the weekend and shave on Monday like I do with my normal razor. Other razors have dragged or pulled the stubble causing great discomfort and razor burn. Sometimes even ingrown hairs. This razor however cut through the stubble with no pulling or dragging. The shave was effortless and the blades rinsed clean each time I ran them under the water. Other blades get clogged and are hard to get clean. The lubricating strip glides across the skin and I didn't have any razor burn or ingrown hairs.<br />I haves used this same razor about 6 times now and it still seems as sharp as day 1. My beard is tough and it really dulls the blades on other razors but so far this razor has surpassed all the others.<br />The single blade trimmer that is on the back of the blades is great for shaving right under my nose where I can't get with the regular set of blades. This is a great option to have all in one product. I am officially switching my razor to Gillette Fusion Power!!!

  166. I've seen this around in stores and wondered why would buy a powdered razor. It seemed \\"gimicky.\\" The extra base cost plus cost of batteries - I just stayed away.<br /><br />And for good reason, since I've been using a normal Fusion Pro-Glide for years and it's worked very well. Quite honestly I would not have ever had used a Fusion Pro-Glide Power if Gillete had not sent me one for free.<br /><br />I like it. I like it alot. In fact I think it be one of those rare instances were fixin' something that ain't broken actually made it better. And why? For me it came down to two huge reasons:<br /><br />1. This razor shaves close and cleanly more so than the non-powered version on the first pass. I actually didn't have to go over any spots on my face like I normally do with the non-powered version<br /><br />2. The vibration action is a monumental help in getting hairs off the razor. Under running water all the trapped hairs come off almost instantly which for me is a big plus so I'm not sitting there banging my razor against the side of the sink.<br /><br />I feel the one detraction from this razor is getting used to the vibration action. I'm still not 100% used to it, and even after multiple shaves now, I still feel kind of uneasy about bringing it to my face, but hey no cuts yet!<br /><br />Overall, a great razor that demonstrates a significant improvement over the original product. While I'm not sure how long the battery will last, I say that the marginal cost over the non-powered version is worth it as an initial investment, and I don't feel that keeping the thing juiced with AAA batteries is going to break the bank.

  177. Up front: I was provided a free GILLETTE FUSION PROGLIDE POWER HANDLE for review via a program run by Gillette.<br /><br />I shave maybe once every 2-3 weeks. I usually let my beard grow out, get sick of it and then get rid of it. I use a pair of electric clippers to trim my beard down to \\"shaveable\\" levels and then have at it.<br /><br />For years I've used a Gillette Mach 3 razor and I've had no issues with it. Honestly, anything that scrapes the hair off my face and doesn't leave me bleeding is pretty much OK in my book. But, since I was given a free razor to try out I figured I'd give it a whirl.<br /><br />The two main differences between what I'm accustomed to with the Mach 3 handle and the Gillette Fusion Proglide Power Razor handle are 1) the handle for the Fusion Proglide is larger, more ergonomic and heavier; 2) the handle for the Fusion is powered (by a AAA battery).<br /><br />The first thing I noticed about the handle is that it has considerable heft to it compared to the Mach 3. I'm sure the battery is most of the weight, but the handle is also a little bigger and contoured (unlike the Mach 3 which is pretty much just a straight shaft). The contours on the handle made it much easier to grip and maneuver with. There's a bulbous end to the handle, which is slightly larger than the rest of the handle, and it made it easy for me to pinch and pivot the handle in my finger tips to get under my neck and chin line. Plus, the heft of the handle really felt good in my hand.<br /><br />The powered handle and the vibration it supplied to the blade definitely felt soothing when shaving.<br /><br />In the end, I do enjoy the handle and I will continue using it for the time being. I like the size, shape and weight of it compared to the Mach 3 handle.

  191. I have been using the Gillette Fusion Pro Glide Power for over a year. I recently received a free one from a program run by Gillette. I think this razor handle is one of the best around and I recommend it if you're thinking about buying one. The rubbery grip stays in your hand very well - I shave in the shower quite often and have no problems. Apparently, the battery compartment is water-tight, because I haven't had any problems with using the razor in the shower. The battery provides the \\"Power\\", which is really just a vibrating motion to the razor blade cartridge. The motion does help reduce drag and allow the razor to glide across my face with less resistance. All in all, this is a great razor handle and I enjoy using it. If I could change anything about it, I'd make it heavier. I like the feel of a hefty razor handle and this one is on the light side, especially if you remove the battery. Otherwise, this truly is a great product.
  192. I have very thick/coarse facial hair, and this makes it difficult most times to shave consistently. Most razors dull after just 1-2 shaves, and even within the first shave will typically catch pretty often.<br /><br />This is not the case with the ProGlide Power Handle and blade. The blade, being so thin, doesn't catch like most other blades. Which makes for a very happy face afterwards.<br />The Power Handle itself was a scary concept at first. I don't want something buzzing on my face that's also slicing so close to the skin! But after a few moments of hesitation, I tried it out, and was pleasantly surprised. It's hard to say if it did a hugely better job, as I was still marveling at the clean smooth cuts from the blade itself, but it did seem to make it easier. It seems that in any situation where it might start catching(getting dull), this might help the blades last a bit longer, as it'll be moving more to cut through the hair, without actually pulling. I haven't gotten the blade dull enough yet after 2 shaves to be able to tell though.<br />Even with the battery in the handle, the weight of the razor was just right, not overly heavy to burden my hand, not overly bulky either, just a good solid handle.<br />I received the Proglide Power Handle as a promotion from Gillette, but I would be more than willing to make this purchase on my own.

My fears of nicks, cuts and a handle that is to large were completely unfounded.

  221. Ok I have to say that when I received the Gillette fusion proglide power razor, via a program run by Gillette, I was skeptical at best. The vibration helps the blade glide over my toughest shave spots.<br /> Now for the razor blade itself, in the past I could only use a blade 3 or 4 times before I just had to get a new one, (which is another reason the big pack of disposables made the most sense).   224. I've been a lifelong Gillette user. (Occasionally I'll try the latest hyped product from Schick but always come back within a week.) When Gillette introduced the \\"power\\" handles in the Fusion line a few years back I immediately fell in love. My skin has never been able to tolerate an electric razor, but the \\"power\\" series is different. The continuous vibration is coupled with a \\"manual\\" razor, simply helping bring hair to the surface for a smooth shave. The Fusion Power was a lifesaver.<br /><br />Now along comes the Fusion \\"ProGlide\\" Power. I received a free razor via a program run by Gillette and gave it a shot for a week. At first glance it's a close cousin of the older Fusion - 5 blades (+ a trimmer blade) on a vibrating handle. Like the previous series the handle is comfortable to hold and the vibration is noticeable but subtle and smooth - the razor doesn't want to jump around while holding it.<br /><br />To my surprise, the shave was noticeably better with the ProGlide. Upon closer inspection I noticed a \\"comb-like\\" row along the bottom edge of the razor. This little comb seems to straighten out the hair as you shave so the hairs hit the blade at the perfect angle... resulting in fewer ingrown hairs (always an issue for me), less irritation, and an overall closer shave. Definitely an improvement over it's predecessor.<br /><br />The handle appears essentially the same as the older Fusion Power, so if you have an older working \\"power\\" handle the ProGlide Power blades are interchangeable. If you haven't tried the \\"power\\" handles I definitely recommend this version - especially guys with sensitive skin. Trust me - the combination of the vibration and that little combing edge on the ProGlide Power blades makes all the difference!
  225. It really is their smoothest shave yet. I used it and had no problems at all shaving with and against the grain. Just learn how to shave properly to avoid any problems.
  226. The unit worked for about about 7 months. Then one day I was walking by and I hear a buzzing sound. I noticed it was the Proglide on. I thought I had turned it on by mistake. Next time, I was careful to switch it off. And then one day after I switch it off, I notice it turns itself on and off. It eventually died, When I opened the battery compartment, it was wet and the battery appeared to be leaking and corroding in the compartment. I let it dry for couple of days and put in a fresh AA and nothing, no light on the button no movement. I definitely got a defective one but please be aware this may happen to you too. The unit is shorted out completely now. My $13 down the drain within a year :(

  240. I wouldn't call me the biggest fan of the Power Handle. I received a free power handle that was provided via a program run by Gillette. While it did create a smoother easier stroke while shaving, in a way, it made shaving a bit more difficult as well. let me explain...<br /><br />Part of knowing your cutting hair when shaving, is by feeling the resistance of the hair while pulling the blade across your face. Also, hearing the hair being cut as well.<br /><br />With the Power Blade turned on, the sound and feel of the vibrations masked the feel and sound of the blade cutting hairs. This tended to make shaving take longer, as I found myself going over some spots more than ones unnecessarily.<br /><br />The shape of the Power Blade made it easy and comfortable to hold, but I pass on the vibrations. I seem to get just as close a shave without it, as I do with it.

  259. I've been using the Gillette regular Fusion razor for many years. The Fusion ProGlide appears to be a bit different visually, but I don't really see much functional difference over the regular Fusion razor. These are good razor blades, but the cons seriously hamper their overall value.<br /><br />PROs:<br />+Extremely close shave--the best I've had with any manual razor.<br />+Nice ergonomics and feel to the handle, and looks nice too.<br />+Comes with an awesome plastic case that securely holds the razor and can clip in a 4-pack of replacement blades underneath. GREAT for travel!<br />+Blades pop on and off easily.<br /><br />CONs:<br />-Biggest CON: Not for those who don't shave daily! I have coarse facial hair and find that if I go longer than a day or two without shaving, this razor just can't cut it without being uncomfortable or painful. I have to first shave with an electric trimmer and then follow up with the Fusion razor.<br />-The clog easily. I have to bang the razor on the sink several times while shaving to clean it out.<br />-The vibrating feature does absolutely nothing for me. I don't notice a single benefit from it and it just gets annoying. I stopped using the battery and just took it out.<br />-If you do use the vibration feature, this Proglide version of the razor has a BRIGHT LED that the regular Fusion did not. It is just too bright and annoying, and why bother? Like we can't tell the thing is ON when it's vibrating? Just a waste of battery power.<br /><br />Overall, I would still continue purchasing these razors after receiving this one for free from a program run by Gillette. Even though they are expensive and have a few cons, the resulting super-close shave is worth putting up with it, and I haven't found anything better yet (but a lot of worse!) I would suggest buying the non-vibrating handle and saving some cash. All of the handles can interchange with all of the blades.

Given the quick-growing, thick facial hair, I can be standing there shaving for 20 minutes, at times. Most razors focus simply on the blades (which, by the way, even the blades for this razor are superb) and leave little attention to the handle. That means that you're essentially holding this hard, slippery pencil in your hands. The second I got the ProGlide Power out of the packaging, I was thrilled to see that this wasn't the case.<br /><br />This was the best grip that I've ever had on any razor in my life. It fit snug, had tiny rubber grooves on the back that molded to my fingers, and wasn't at all slippery. You can definitely feel a difference with the side grips that are on the Power handle. Between the superb handle and the tremendous razor, I found myself with the closest, smoothest, easiest shave-job of my life. This is a product that I will buy over and over and over again.

I don't know for sure if it is the power or the configuration of the blades, but I definitely feel like it had a better shave than a 'non-power' razor. Is this worth the extra cost? I don't know.   269. I mostly use the cheapest razors I can find, but after getting a sample of the Gillette Fusion ProGlide power handle it's a night and day difference between this razor and others. I've noticed with the Gillette Fusion my face is smoother throughout the day much longer compared to my old cheap razors.<br /> I sure everyone has that one area of your face, chin, or neck that you just can't get a close shave to. The Gillette Fusion ProGlide now makes it easier to get to the problem areas in a couple passes. Also, what I liked about this razor is I can wet my face with water and still get a close shave without the shaving cream. And I have been using this razor with the same blade in now for 3 weeks, and I still did not get razor burn with my sensitive skin. I would recommend this to anyone who wants a close, long-lasting, shave.

Provided a close and smooth shave. Minimum pulling or tugging on hairs. I recommend Gillette products as my first option to anyone.<br /><br />The handle has an on-board micro chip that is suppose to provide consistent power, shave after shave. This feature I found didn't provide any difference from when I used when I had the power on than if used with power off. For others this may be more useful. I am not sure if this could be related to hair type.

  272. I'm trying out the ProGlide for free through a program run by Gillette. I must admit that it turned out a little better than expected. The handle feels comfortable in my hands and easily maneuverable around my face and neck. Grips prevent slippage when hands are slippery with shaving gel. Gave a great shave as my skin tends to be very sensitive to razors. Felt some tug on my skin during the shave and had to use a few strokes over each area to get all the hairs cut. Sometimes had to press a little firmer to get those stubborn hairs. Very light weight even with the battery. Overall shave result was smooth, non-irritated soft skin with a very pleasant surprise, no bumps or pain after a few days.
  273. So, to begin with, I should say that I'm not really sure how I feel about the handle. Gillette gave me an opportunity to try it out and I gave it 3 stars, but that's because it gets the job done. Any product that does what it's supposed to should probably almost full credit. With that in mind, I think it might be a little too fancy for my liking. The grip on the handle is fine, it doesn't get too slippery when it's wet and it's certainly not uncomfortable to hold. The vibrating head is also a cool addition, but I'm not convinced that it adds to my shave. It feels pretty much the same to me when I use the vibrating and when I use don't use it.<br /><br />The one thing I am stuck on with this handle is that it reminds me of a teenager and his car. This handle is that 16 year old with a tricked out shiny Honda Civic with loud exhaust and a cool sound system. Oh, and don't forget the sweet rims. But the problem is just that-- it looks cool, but doesn't do anything a normal Civic would not. This razor looks and feels awesome, but at the end of the day it still shaves my face just like any other razor would. I have the used normal non-vibrating Gillette for some time now, and I don't think this fancier looking, vibrating device makes any difference.<br /><br />All things considered, this is really just an average handle that looks cool. It definitely seems like more a novelty than anything, and some people like that. Objectively, however, I think that the \\"close shave\\" this handle helps provide is more mind over matter. Realistically, I get just as close of a shave without vibration and anyone who says otherwise may just be fooled by the cool looks and neat vibration. Don't get me wrong, this handle functions 100% and will give you a good shave, but it's not because of the ergonomic grip and electronics.
  274. I was given a free razor from a program run by Gillete.<br /><br />The handle:<br />When using the razor I thought the handle was comfortable with lots of grip. Having a handle with a good grip allowed me to have smooth strokes reducing nicks and cuts on my face. It is a solid handle without any bend to it. It is thick enough to easily grab and small enough not to be a brick.<br /><br />The blades:<br />I thought the blades were pretty average. I didn't hate it but I didn't love either. I'm the guy with bumpy sensitive skin that razors never work well on so I thought I'd give this a try. When using the shaver the blades seemed to cut great. I mean it has 5 blades, I don't think that will ever be an issue till they get dull. The part I really like are these shavers with the lubrication strip. My only issue is for me personally after going over my whole face and neck I still get hair that are missed. The lubrication strip makes it smooth with the grain..but anytime I rub my skin against the grain I can feel the hairs. Whenever I try to get them (against the grain) I always cut myself, which is true with this razor.

  284. I was recently given a free Gillette Fusion Proglide Power Razor via a program run by Gillette. The razor comes in packaging that is easy to remove without using sharp objects. Included in the package were the razor, a stand, and a AAA battery. At first glance, the razor looks to by typically made in the same high quality fashion that Gillette has made standard amongst most of their razors. The razor has a good weight to it when the battery is inserted and it looks and feels like it could withstand just about anything. Shaving with the Gillette was relatively easy and provides a great shave; especially with micro pulsation technology that Gillette has developed. For the first few days, the Gillette razor provided a very smooth shave and was relatively knick free. The flexibility of the shaver head and the lubrication pad made shaving smooth, effortless, and pulling was minimal. Cleaning the razor was very easy and removal and re installation of the razor was simply a button push and a click away. After use, the razor fit snugly into its holder and provided the best position for drying the razor until the next use. In my opinion, I am giving the Gillette Fusion Proglide razor three stars because it did do pretty well over the period of a week, but it did fall short in a few areas. First, Gillette provides a single blade on the back of the razor that you have to flip over to use to get to those hard to reach areas, but I did prefer the feeling of four blades as compared to one from my normal everyday razor. Secondly, at the end of a week or so, the Gillette razor started to pull on my face a little more because the blades were dulling even with the micro pulsations. Although switching blades is normal maintenance that must be completed on a razor, this was a little premature for a blade to start dulling this quick. Lastly, the cost of the razor could be the worst thing about it. With the blades dulling so quickly and the use of a battery to drive the micro pulse technology, this increases the cost of this razor exponentially. I was hoping to be pleasantly surprised by the Gillette Proglide and at first I was, but overall I would say that it would be hard for me to switch my razor to the Gillette if you are looking to save money.
  285. I received this as a promo from Gillette. It works relatively well.   295. I got the ProGlide Power Handle free as part of a promotional program from Gillette. Generally, I use Schick xTreme 3 disposables, so that's kind of my reference point for comparison.<br /><br />This razor does an excellent job on the face, and I have no complaints in that regard. It's a quality handle with an excellent blade that does a great (albeit expensive) job.<br /><br />My gripes come from the perspective of a head-shaver. I've been using the Schicks for a long time because they're super lightweight and comfortable to hold while my arm is up in the air. They have a flat spot just behind the head to put my fingers and keep everything in line. This battery-loaded handle, although it provides an interesting vibration feature, is none of those things. It's very heavy, not conducive to a reverse-grip, and the \\"precision trim\\" blade on the back keeps catching on my fingernails.<br /><br />I'd strongly recommend this for face-shavers who can afford it (refills are fairly pricey but should last a month or more); but for head-shavers who don't hold the razor the way face-shavers do, I don't suggest laying down the money to try this handle.

  302. I received this shaver for review as part of a program by Gillette. The handle is the same as the older Fusion Power with the only real difference being the color styling (blue instead of orange). The \\"power\\" part of these handles is simply a vibrator that shakes vibrates the razor much like the vibration ring on your cell phone. For me this feature doesn't make a difference, the shave is the same with or without the \\"power\\"/vibration turned on. Often though I just forget to turn it on because there is no difference. So I'd say the \\"power\\" part is just gimmick. The good news is that the handle is fully compatible with the Fusion Power cartridge and vice versa. So there is no need to upgrade to the Proglide handle to use the Proglide cartridges. You also can use the old Fusion Power cartridges with the new handle. Both the Proglide and Fusion Power are nice handles and needed for the high quality Gillette blade cartridges.

  323. This razor is amazing, but I had to get used to the fact that it vibrated, or as they call it \\"Micropulses\\" a bit when I shaved. It is battery operated so it vibrates a little when you shave. I thought this was going to be another gimmick, but it actually worked somehow. I sometimes get ingrown hairs when I shave and it didn't happen with this. I don't know if it is the thinner blades or what, but this is worth the money.<br />I got this razor free from a program that Gillette was running, and it is great marketing on their part because I am no longer using my old razors.   324. Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power handle is an amazing device that enhances a truly smooth shave. As part of a program sponsored by Gillette, I had the opportunity to try out the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power handle for free. The grip design is ergonomically created in such a way that it allows for a smoother, easier shave. The rubberized handle is easy to hold in various positions to allow for an easy way to hold the handle when trying to reach those hard to reach parts of the face. The button that releases the blade is quick and easy to use. When changing blades this button works great. It is so easy to change blades based on the design. There is no muss or fuss and you don't even have to touch the blade to remove it from the handle. The vibration factor is easy to use. The button quickly and easily turns on the vibration action of the handle. The handle vibration really enhances the shave quality and the functionality of the handle itself. The Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power handle improves the smoothness of the shave and allows for a clean and easy shave. The handle is a truly revolutionary design, and I am so happy to have had the opportunity to try this new and exciting way to shave.

  328. I received a free Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power as part of a Gillette run program. I have had the best shaving experience with a mukti-blade razor than ever before. I typically use a double-edge safety razor. It is the only way I have been able to shave every day and eliminate razor burn. The vibrating pulses in this new Gillette allow me to shave as close as the old style razor while still eliminating razor burn. That, and it does it in half the time. The handle is easy to grip and maneuver around my face. The only downside is my finger can easily accidentally disable the vibrating pulse when changing grips.   344. I received a Fusion ProGlide power handle through a Gillette promotion. I was a bit apprehensive since I used a power handle with a different razor before and did not like the way the vibration felt in my hand. The Fusion power handle has vibration that is a significant improvement over a different power handle I tried a couple years ago.<br /><br />I have used the Fusion blades without the power handle and they seemed to pull at my hair more than I like, however the vibration removed the pulling and helped me get a very close shave for my wedding day with minimal irritation (all of which cleared up in plenty of time for the pictures).<br /><br />For the handle itself, it grips well, but feels beefy after using other disposable handles for over 10 years. Also, there are some ridges on the bottom that improve how well I can grip a wet handle, but the ridges still feel odd in my hand even after a full month of use.<br /><br />Overall, if you use Fusion blades and it feels like they pull a bit on your stubble, I highly recommend upgrading to the power handle.

  355. Gillette was running a free program to try out their new razor, the fusion profiled power, and as a long time fan of Gillette, I couldn't refuse. I have a fusion shaver from a couple years ago which may seem very similar, but I found a particularly different experience.<br />My old fusion shaver was already great, but I still experienced the issue of cutting myself in several places and the shave hurting when having too much facial hair. With the new shaver, however, things changed and I suddenly got far fewer cute, a much less painful shave, and an even faster shave. I noticed the blade and design was a bit different, indicating probably why my shave was so different from an older model fusion blade. The power vibrate seems more powerful but just as gentle while the blade has been improved to be even smoother on the skin. For people with sensitive skin like me, they'll love it. The aesthetics of the shaver itself makes it look cutting edge (no pun intended), futuristic, and impressive. The holder even has a new look and it seems all these add up to a fantastic shaver. The company recommends to change the blade after every 4 or so uses but in my personal opinion, with such a clean and smooth blade, the blade can last you several more uses than that. I don't write reviews much but I highly recommend this!<br />Pros:<br />* Clean and smooth shave.<br />* fast shave<br />* much less painful than other shavers and therefore great for sensitive skin<br />* very close shave as expected<br />* power vibrate function gives an even smoother and closer shave<br />* very aesthetically pleasing design<br />* good grip<br />* inexpensive<br />* blade lasts quite a while<br />Cons:<br />* although I cut myself much less than previous shavers, I still minorly cut myself in 1 or 2 places<br />* hair may get stuck in blade when shaving too thick of a beard... trim first! This goes for any shaver<br />* Not much else<br />Summary: Highly recommended blade and I can't think of anything else that's THIS great other than a profession Hollywood barber shave. Razor burn is often caused by improper facial lubrication and dull blades. By using this razor I pulled 10-15 blades across my face, but when using my standard single blade razor I only pull 3 blades across ... My math may be off, but that is significantly different. The blades themselves did last a few shaves longer than a standard single blade, but at what cost 10 - 20 times. The trimming blade work out EXTREMELY FAST and the actual shave was not nearly as good as advertised<br /><br />I do not think the vibrating handle did anything, but annoy me. This maybe because I properly wash my face before I shave so my facial hair is all ready to be shaved.<br /><br />I personally recommend buying a good quality handle, quality double edge shaving blades and quality shaving soaps. It will take a little while longer to shave and some practice, but you will be pleasantly surprised at the quality of shave and the lower cost.

There's no plugging in the razor as it's battery operated and a nice feature is that the \\"power on\\" light flashes when the battery is running low and needs to be replaced soon.   374. Being in a job where I need to shave every day, having a quality razor, and one that's economically sound is very important. I've used a variety of razors including the fusion, hydro and Mach 3. Overall, I find the fusion power proglide to be one of the better ones.<br /><br />The good: despite what I've seen in some reviews, I actually do get a better, closer shave with the powered fusion over non-powered razors. I find the blades shave smoothly, with no noticeable pulling along or against the grain. The blades are also fairly forgiving on skin (I tend to shave without shaving cream and rarely experienced any razor burn with the fusion power).<br /><br />The bad: my beard tends to be on the rough side, and with everyday shaving, I find that an average blade only has a 4-5 day optimal sharpness. After that, they do begin to noticeably dull (although as I said, this may be due to my beard texture and shaving needs).

  376. I was skeptical when I turned on this razor because the blades don't move, instead the razor just vibrates. However, this razor is absolutely wonderful. However, once you power it on, the vibration allows it to glide smoothly over your body. When I shave with my normal razors I always get pin hole knicks all over my body (about 8-15) and come out of the shower bleeding. With this razor, I only had one knick--simply amazing. Because it gives a close, smooth, and knick-free shave I absolutely love it--5 stars all the way.<br /><br />I also had my boyfriend try it and he said it was great, although he mentioned that the blade was too large (due to the five blades) to shave under his nose easily but he could get use to that. He also said it shaves as close as his ordinary razor. I only cut myself about three times in the three years I've used this.<br /><br />UPDATE June 23, 2014 - After 4 years, this razor has finally died. The seal holding the battery compartment is no longer leak-proof so now I will order another one. I love this razor and have used no other razor (except to try one or two new ones that I got for free).
  377. With the claims of a revolutionary razor, I believe most of the hype to be exactly that, hype. Took a shower, washed my face. Applied Gillette Fusion shaving cream and tested it next to my old Fusion. No difference, what so ever. The \\"larger handle\\" is not that big of a deal, compared to the fact that a Powered Fusion has roughly the same handle size. The shave was no closer, it was no smoother, I could tell no difference what so ever in razors besides the pretty blue light on my new ProGlide. Having said that, I can't complain, they sent it too me for free. It's an excellent marketing ploy designed to influence Americans to buy whatever product big businesses want us to buy next. Having said that, I see no reason to switch from my old Fusion to newer and more expensive cartridges. It received three stars due to the promises made by Gillette, and the fact there older products are just as functional as this newer, more expensive one.
  378. Since I started shaving a few years ago I've been using the bottom-of-the-barrel cheapo razor blades and dealt with irritating tug, ingrown hairs, and skin discoloration. So, it goes without saying when I figured I had enough of my face and chin looking like a rocky road I was bound to notice improvements when I picked up this razor, and I did. Quality isn't an issue here: the razor looks great, and gives me a very smooth shave. There is also a vibrating function which I choose to use since it eliminates just about any tug I feel on my skin. My shave feels much more comfortable, looks better, and even with 5 blades it works well against my sensitive skin which I already see improving. The precision trimmer edges up nicely for the clean cut look, but after experimenting I also feel it's a less risky shave than the main blades around the \\"danger zone\\" chin and neck area. So now, I got my free razor from Gillette, love it and plan on getting more razors/blades...whats the catch? At almost four bucks a blade for refills, this is simply outrageous and it's a dealbreaker for me. I'll keep using these until the razors I currently have go dull (luckily that will take a while) and downgrade to the original Gillette Fusion Blades unless the price of refills goes down.
  379. I've been using the (old) Fusion to shave my head for several years now. Based on the hype, I decided to spring for the new Proglide. I didn't see a difference between the old Fusion and the Proglide Fusion. No more/less irritation, pulling, etc.<br /><br />My recommendation ...if you're an existing Fusion user, don't bother. If you're using anything with less than 5 blades, give it a try.
  380. since the trend to powered razors has started I've tried several and haven't been very impressed. the M3 was the best I had tried before, but this new Fusion Proglide actually is pretty comfortable. I only have to shave about every 3 days so I'm lucky, but my skin is fairly sensitive. most razors are a little rough, this one actually feels smooth for the most part. of course to me it's more about the shaving cream and the after shave, but figured I'd throw my 2cents in and recommend this razor if you're like me.
  381. I have shaved with Gilette since high school and have tried everything they make including the original sensor, sensor excel, mach 3, disposable pivot plus, and my favorite the disposable Sensor 3 http://www.amazon.com/Gillette-Disposable-Sensitive-Lubrastrip-Packages/dp/B001F51QWK/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&s=hpc&qid=1281647873&sr=1-2 . For me I get these at local grocery store 4 pack for 5 6 bucks which comes out to 1.50 a razor.   382. I received this in the mail for free when Gilette was promoting the release of this razor. Since I have a unisex name, I occasionally get men's products. Anyway, I gave this a try, and I really love it. I've never used a razor with the vibrating feature on it before, but I found this great for my legs, especially my knees and ankles. I've NEVER cut myself using this blade, because with the vibration turned on, it's pretty much impossible for me to press down too hard. It doesn't vibrate too much to where it's noisy or annoying.<br /><br />As far as performance, this razor makes my legs super smooth. I can go 2-3 days between shaves, and when my hair starts to regrow, the hair is finer and not as \\"stubbly.\\" I tend to find razors with 5-blades overdoing it a little, but I've never gotten such a smooth shave with either disposables or women-specific razors, like the Venus. I also love that this works so well on my underarms. Because it's such a weirdly-shaped and sensitive area, I've never had completely, baby-smooth underarms before. This shaves super close without cutting or razor burn. And my legs are smooth ALL day, even if I shave at 8 in the morning. They still have that wonderful, smooth feeling against my sheets when I climb into bed that night. Ladies, you know what I'm talking about.<br /><br />I haven't had any problems with the blades getting clogged, and shaving with this razor is super quick and easy. The blades seem to last a while, at least 3-4 weeks shaving every other day or so. However, when they go dull, they go dull quickly.<br /><br />The only things I didn't like about this razor: one, it didn't come with a blade refill, like every other razor I've ever bought, so that was kind of annoying. Also, the refills are expensive. Don't buy the \\"power\\" refills if you don't use the trimmer- that's the only difference between the \\"power\\" blades and the \\"manual\\" blades, and there's a dollar difference between the two. I don't use the trimmer and it kind of freaks me out that it's just an exposed blade on the opposite side, but I can see how men might find it useful.<br /><br />Overall, this is my favorite razor. I bought the refills even though they were expensive, and will probably be sticking with this for a long time.just an exposed blade on the opposite side, but I can see how men might find it useful. Overall, this is my favorite razor. I bought the refills even though they were expensive, and will probably be sticking with this for a long time.
  383. This razor does a good job of what it is intended to do - give a clean, close shave and not cause razor burn in the process. The blade sharpness seems to last about the same as other blades and it is evident from the razor drag when it is time to change to a new blade. The only negative impressions I had were figuring out how to load the battery in the handle and the cost of replacement blades which are quite a bit more than standard disposable razor blades. If comfort and a close shave is more important than price then this is a good razor for you.

  395. The best shave ever, smooth and close. In the past several months, I've been getting razor burns from my first generation Fusion razor. I was able to pivot the razor and change directions with ease, no cuts, no nicks, and no razor burns. My second, third and subsequent shaves were just as good as the first.
