I like that you can use it in or out of the shower even though I was a little unsure about this at first. It feeld good in my hand and gets the job done. If you're into buying the latest and greatest then Gillette doesn't disappoint, but if you're a creature of habit I am not sure it's worth the price to try and see.
  914. Love this product. It's really great. I have been looking for a good razor for a long time. Will definitely be buying again. Ps, this is my girlfriend's amazon account. I am a man.
  915. I've been using the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power handle for the last few weeks. I received it for free through a Gillette promotion. I feel that is an upgrade over the regular plain jane Gillette Fusion handle. The handle is physically bigger than the regular handle to accommodate the battery. I feel like the larger size helps me grip the handle better and provides a better grip, especially on days I shave while in the shower. The Micropulses only add a little bit of improvement over the regular handle. Some days I feel like it does provide a smoother shave, and other days I don't notice the difference. Overall the Gillette Fusion ProGlide provdes a great shave.
  916. I was recently given the opportunity to review The Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power handle as part of a promotion by Gillette. It was the first time I have used a razor handle that vibrates. I'm not sure what benefit this was supposed to provide to me. I turned it on and used it, it made my skin vibrate, which made me nervous that I was going to cut myself.<br /><br />The handle was comfortable to hold, when it wasn't vibrating, otherwise the vibration went all the way down your hand, which made it feel less steady.<br /><br />I felt kind of strange using it, and would probably use it again without the vibration. My wife made a comment that it looked like something she would use, and not me.<br /><br />I probably will not use the handle again, unless it is turned off.
  917. I have been loving my new Gillette Fusion Proglide power handle since I received it a few weeks ago free via a program Gillette is running. I have needed a power handle that accurately shaves even if its wet and the side grips on this new power handle have done just that. I recommend anyone interested in a improved power handle from Gillette pick this up right now!
  918. I received the Power Handle for free from Gillette. There is alot to like about this handle. First it has the teardrop shape at the bottom of the handle which fits nicely in the palm of you hand. Because of this, you can easily move around your face. Second is the rubber grip handle, it is tacky, but not sticky, and does not get slippery even with soapy hands. Next, the whole handle is waterproof, so you can take full advantage of the power feature in the shower! Lastly, is the power feature itself, it makes the handle buzz ever so slightly in your hand, and it feels like it help to give you a closer shave. Great all around product.

  920. Since I have sensitive skin, I usually use a Mach 3 razor. I was lucky to be able to try a free sample Gillette sent me. I was curious to see if this razor would give a closer shave. I compared shaves side by side (different sides of my face and neck) and the Fusion seemed to give a smoother shave. I let my stubble grow out for a few days to see if I could notice a difference and I didn't.<br /><br />I like to shave in the shower, so the Fusion held up to that test. It's heavier than the Mach 3, but that's to be expected with a battery razor.<br /><br />The blades seem to last as long as the Mach 3 as well. The Fusion's blades are very expensive, maybe a little pricer than the Mach 3. In the future, I might buy the ones on sale. They're very comparable.<br /><br />As for the power handle, I like it. It gives little pulses that help the blades massage my skin. I was very happy with the shave afterwards. Sometimes I get little nicks, but I didn't with the power handle.<br /><br />I do like that the razor gave me a good shave and didn't damage my skin.

  927. I got this free from a program sponsored by Gilette. I was probably even more skeptical of the power handle than I was of the \\"magical\\" five-blade cartridges (but they won me over, too), so you can imagine my surprise when I discovered how much easier it was to shave with the power handle. The vibration seemed to make the razor slice through stubble twice as easy as before, as though it turned the stationary blades into a sort of oscillating saw you'd use to cut drywall, but on a much smaller scale. If that sounds terrifying, it isn't. It took a lot of the \\"work\\" out of the shave, so there was less pulling on the hairs as the blade sliced them, which reduced the potential for razor burn. If you have the opportunity to get the power handle (or better yet, try your friend's, if he'll let you), I would definitely recommend it.

  929. This handle is was provided to me for free by a program being run by Gillette. I enjoyed the shave very much, and this coming from a guy who usually uses an electric razor. The power button lights up bright blue, so it is easy to remember to turn it off. I have started shaving without the power on a couple of times.   952. I've owned Gillette products since I started shaving and it's been now 25 years of using their products, so I can say that I have seen the changes that have been made, the good from bad and now the close-to the best handle that feels right! Just a bit about my skin type and hair type because lets face it everyone is different and will experience this product in their own way. I have sensitive thin skin and black course hair on my chin yet more soft hair on the sides. I use to break out in rashes easily so it was important for me to make sure the blades are always sharp and I shave with one stroke. This razor was provided through a program by Gillette and when it arrived I was excited to take it for a test drive and this is what I thought...<br /><br />The Looks:<br />This handle design is by far the coolest. With base being chrome, blue trim highlights, black rubberized grip and on button that lights up when the unit is on. It also comes with a holder that's well thought out. At first I did not notice, but this thing can stand up right as well as flat down. Great for medicine cabinets that have little room or bathroom counters that need all the retail space. An added feature is that when you are done and the unit is still wet the water does not fall forward but slides down to the bottom of the handle where the holder has a lip and scope that directs the water back or collects in the scoop. Great if you want to keep water marks off the counter.<br /><br />The Feel:<br />I have average hands enough to just hold a basketball with one hand and slim fingers. If the handle is too skinny it does not work for me so I needed a handle that will be able to stick to my hand when shaving the harder areas like the jaw line. The sides are ribbed and feel sold. There is also more rubber on the underside so when you curl your fingers around the handle you got grip!. They even have rubber grip at the very bottom of the handle where batteries go, great for the last pinky finger as it curls the base. Basically the stickiest handle without looking all rubberized!<br /><br />The Shave:<br />So I've tried this with different lengths of hair from very small bristle (5 O'clock shadows) to very long borderline having to trim first (7mm hair length). In all cases this baby was able to give me a clean shave with no rashes or tugs. The longest hair did take longer but the vibrations of the blades allowed it to glide with ease. When I went to wash the hair off the blades there no clogging! This makes it quicker to shave if you have to rush off to work. Getting the sideburns cut straight was a breeze. You also have precision blade that can clean up the line after you use the flat side. The sound of the vibrations were a bit louder from the older versions but nothing close to the sound of any electric shavers. I guess with louder vibrations you also get stronger vibrations, able to handle when pressing down on your skin. Overall I get an excellent shave without worrying about nicks or rashes.<br /><br />The Con:<br />The only thing I could say about this unit is the on/off button that lights up when in use would drain the battery faster than not having it on. It's great that the light flashes when the batteries are low but why have the light on the whole time while you shave? it's not like you can see the button while shaving. I think a better use would be when you turn on the unit if the lights flash then that's when you need to change the batteries.<br /><br />Overall:<br />Excellent handling, well thought out, and my new favorite! I would highly recommend this shaver!
  953. The Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power is the best razor I've ever used. I received a free sample razor and I use it about twice a week. The blade gives me the closest shave I've had in years, with little to no nicks. The handle is great too - has a good grip and makes it easy to use.

  967. When I was in high school I tried to wet shave for the first time and I quickly found out that I have sensitive skin.   968. Recently, I was provided a Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power Razor System to use and review, complimentary of a program run by Gillette. I am a lifelong user of Gillette razors so was excited when I was given the opportunity to test out the latest one. Its a nice looking razor, looks high quality, and like a well made product. This razor gives an extremely close smooth shave. It doesnt pull at all, even when shaving against the grain and does not matter if you shave daily or have several days of growth, either way, the razor is quality and does not pull and tug at the hair, which is very nice and very important when you have sensitive skin like I do. The little moisture strip at the top of the razor seems to really help in allowing it to glide over your skin easily. As well, the razor holds up to multiple shaves. I liked that I dont have to use a new blade every single time I shave. With this razor, I can use it several times and each time is just like the first in quality of shave.<br />I really like the Power feature. I think it aids in getting that super close smooth shave. I also just happen to like the vibrating feature. The handle is just the right size and fits in your hand nicely and the grips are nice to keep from dropping the razor when shaving in the shower. The only thing I would change in this aspect is to provide a better grip in the thumb area. I was comparing this particular razor to another Gillette Fusion razor I have and my other one has the thumb grip and I wish this one did as well.<br />Overall, this is another great high quality Gillette razor system. Its worth the money, even if you spend full price on it. I did get this one complimentary, but I often buy a second system so I have one for home and one for use when I travel. My wife often finds great savings for these razor systems so it is possible toget it for a much lower price than the average retail cost. The only negative thing I really have to say about it is that the refill blades are a bit pricey. However, that said, if you use coupons and shop around you can get a good price, and this razor is well worth the money. Its the best Gillette razor so far. I am all for the five blade razors. Until I used them, I didnt think they would be any better than what I was currently using, but after having used a high quality five blade razor like this, I couldnt go back to the regular cheaper ones. Its easy to get spoiled to the super close shave this razor system provides! And, its well made so the handle will hold up for years. I like that they handles are made well enough to last as long as you want to keep them....and its only necessary to replace blades as they dull and an occasional battery replacement. I look forward to using this razor for quite some time.
  969. the power is superfluous ，I used gillette 3 which i think is better than this one ，although this is the update
  970. This is my first time to use a razor in the new style. I am used to the old convention of using the Blade and found this as a great. It is pretty easy to shave even thick and hard beard, without any irritation.

  973. I've been using Gillette products all of my adult life (40+ years), and have always been happy with them all.<br /><br />For a long time now, I've been using a Mach 3 razor (1st generation), and have been very happy with it also.<br />I would consider my beard full, and thick, just tough beard hair to shave.<br /><br />I decided to try this \\"Fusion Proglide Men's Power Razor\\".<br />I was a bit intrigued by the addition of a battery, to vibrate the razor, with slight motion, possibly adding to it's ability to shave even closer.<br />Plus it's use of 4 blades, and the thinnest used to date , that aid in less irritation, and a closer shave.<br /><br />I will say that this is a good razor, but the battery & the vibration, I have tried it, and see no benefit. At least no measurable benefit.<br />I honestly didn't notice any improvement in closeness, or less irritation, than I got with my Mach 3 razor.<br /><br />Both razors give me a very close shave, with very, very little, to no irritation!<br /><br />So it's brand new, and have used it, so for now, I'll keep using both, and try and decide which is actually better. At this point, I just can't tell any difference.<br /><br />My end opinion is: if your already using a Mach 3, just stick with it.<br />I think your best investment would be to find a good shaving cream/gel, that works best for you!<br />If your looking for a good razor with 4 blades, you may love this razor.

  977. I tried the Gillette ProGlide Razor this week, via a free sample program run by Gillette. I have a few opinions that I'd like to share.<br /><br />Firstly, the handle on my razor was a bit too skinny, and with wet hands, I fumbled with it a little bit. Not too big of a deal once I got used to the dimensions.<br /><br />I'll admit, the shave is nice. There was very little irritation after I shaved, and for the most part, I was nice and smooth.<br /><br />Unfortunately, there are a few drawbacks. The \\"precision trimmer\\" is awful. I could not, for the life of me, get the bottoms of my sideburns to look clean, and it actually nicked a small cut on the underside of my earlobe as I was shaving near it. This is an unacceptable design and desperately needs a flip-top to protect it. I actually needed to break out my usual razor to trim up my goatee and sideburns, as the trimmer was just simply inadequate.<br /><br />Overall, if you don't have a lot of facial hair, and don't need to trim around sideburns or a goatee, you could do OK with this razor. I, however, am going to stick to my preferred razor.

  986. As part of a promotion from Gillette I received a free razor. I know it'll sound like that clouded my review but honestly, this is the best razor I've ever used. I have sensitive skin and no matter what I try (all those new razors with 5-6 blades, the lubricating strips, etc.) I always end up bleeding or at minimum with my neck very red, bumpy and on fire. Not so with this razor. I'm able to get an incredibly close, clean shave with minimal effort and no irritation. Normally I'll have to wait a couple days or so between shaves or else my skin is just too sensitive for a shave, with these blades I'm able to shave every day.<br /><br />The razor pivots so it follows the contours of your face really well without having to pull and stretch your face to get all those different curves. I'm not really certain what the power bit does, I guess the vibration must perk up the hairs to get that extra close shave? Whatever it is it works. The precision edging blade is a really nice bonus for getting those extremely difficult little areas like right under the nose and for edging the sideburn area nicely.<br /><br />Perfectly smooth, close, irritation free shave, wouldn't change a thing.

  1017. I was excited to try the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power (what can I say, the commericals are catchy).   1028. I've been using a Gillette MACH3 since 1995, and it's served me well. Matter of fact, I have two MACH3 razors, one for home and one for traveling. The MACH3's have always treated me well and did a great job for my shaving needs. One day, I received a free razor offer from Gillette's free trial program, I jumped on the offer right away.<br /><br />At first, I was a bit leery of the \\"power\\" function because I was afraid to cut myself due to the vibrating mechanism. However, once I started to shave, the power function didn't cause any damage, so I am much at ease with it. The blades on the ProGlide are SUPER SHARP! When I was shaving, I didn't feel the usual \\"cutting\\" sensation like I was used to. I had to double check the shaved area to make sure the razors did its job. The result was a super clean and smooth shave.   1030. The Gillette Fusion Proglide razor is a unique style of razor that uses vibration to help lift and separate stubble so that it's easier to trim. The pulsating handle may initially take some getting used to but once you do, it's an unobtrusive feature that does have some benefits.<br /><br />First, the handle itself. It's a well designed handle with soft grip sections that make for easy maneuvering. I was able to easily switch the way I was holding the handle several times while I was shaving. It feels like it was perfectly designed to fit snugly in the hand and it's definitely easy to use.<br /><br />I shaved half of my face with the power on and half with the power off. I didn't notice much difference either way until I shaved those hard to smooth mutton chop areas. Here, the vibrating pulses came in handy. By using the vibration feature I was actually able to get a closer shave than without the vibrations. So while in general the feature may seem gimmicky, it's benefits are undeniable. This feature brings together the best of two worlds: the smoothness of a blade shave with the vibration feature of an electric razor. The on/off button is perfectly located and it's set back enough so that it need not come in contact with water when rinsing the blades.<br /><br />I would recommend the Gillette Fusion Proglide razor to anyone looking to revisit blade shaving; especially those that have been reluctant to put aside their electric shaver.<br /><br />The razor was provided to me free via a program run by Gillette.

  1044. I've only used gillette razors in the past (Mach 3, fusion, fusion ProGlide, all with various brands of shave gel. I'm currently using the Gillette Fusion HydraGel), but this is the first time i've used one of the powered handles. I received the Fusion ProGlide Power handle and blade as part of a free campaign run by Gillette and BzzAgent After using for about a week and a half, i'm definitely a fan of it so far. My skin tends to be a little bit on the sensitive side, and I also tend to get as much use out of my blades as possible, given the price of replacements. Usually after about a week, i really start feeling the difference in the quality of the shave. So far, after almost two weeks, the blade still feels almost new. One reason i've never used a powered handle up until now is that I wasn't sure how annoying the vibration would get after using this handle regularly. Again, so far no complaints. The vibration seems to be enough to make a difference in the shave, but not enough to result in any annoyance or discomfort during use. The added battery also doesn't add very much bulk to the product, which was another reason i've been hesitant to try these in the past. The product gets a 4 out of 5 due to the high price (which is not unique to this product).

  1050. After receiving the Gillette Fusion Pro Glide Power Razor thru a free Gillette offer, I was skeptical at first. I have been a user of their products for over 7 years and thought that I had found the Mach III Power to be the best that they made. Man was I amazed to see that this razor puts that one to shame. They may have converted their hardest to please customer.<br /><br />From the start it was off in the right direction. There isn't anything that I can't stand more, than having to fight to get your product out of its packaging to use it. I was very impressed with the packaging on this product being the easiest to open that I have ever seen. One tab on the back and pull! That easy! Great Start!<br /><br />Loading the battery on the unit is the same as my other model so no problems there. The one thing I did notice is that the handle itself was a little more bulky and had a feel that you knew you were holding it, unlike some disposables that are so light.<br /><br />The large groves on the handle were nice for gripping, especially since your hands get wet and possibly slippery when shaving with shaving cream or gel. No problems with managing it. The vibration feature I felt wasn't as smooth as the Mach III that I usually use. It seemed to be a little slower, but this could have been the battery that was included with the razor. I found that the button for the on/off of the vibration wasn't very easy to push and that it would have been better placed on the razor if it were closer to the blade by about an inch, or above the grip.<br /><br />The illuminated power button was a nice touch but not necessary. It was nice to see that it had a feature to shut off if on longer than 8 Minutes, great for travel. The other feature that I was impressed with was that it will flash when the battery is low, much better than it just dying on you mid-shave.<br /><br />This razor contours nicely to your face and offers a great shave. The handle could use a little tweaking, but overalla great product.<br /><br />I am only giving this 4 stars because I feel that the layout of the handle and its button didn't impress me. When I need to shut it off I would rather not have to fumble with two hands to get to the button and push hard, I would rather be able to do this with one hand.<br /><br />Would still highly recommend this product to others for its unbelievably close shave! My best yet!
  1051. I received a free Gillette Fusion ProGlide razor through a promo program run by Gillette. Clearly, a ton of thought and research went into designing this handle. The power button is recessed just enough to make it such that you will not turn the razor off accidentally. However, I have never had a problem with turning it on or off on the first attempt. The battery compartment is secure, and will not come off while shaving. However, an easy twist allows the end to come off giving quick access to the battery when it needs to be changed. The non-slip rubber surfaces allow for usage in the shower with very little risk of the razor slipping, even when your hands are covered in lather. All in all, this is a fantastically engineered handle!<br /><br />I have used multi-blade razors before and frequently I had trouble getting the stubble washed out from between the blades. However, the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power cartridge does not have this problem, despite having more blades than any other razor I have ever used. Additionally, it delivers an extremely close shave. I had no problems with nicks anywhere, including my chin and neck. On top of that, the precision trimmer blade on the back of the cartridge took care of the hard to shave area under my nose. All in all, the blades on this razor are fantastic!

  1060. First off Gillette provided me with a power proglide to try and I love this razor. This review is of the handle. I should start by saying I have large hands (think XL size gloves). I've used this razor a good 10 times now, and here are the things I like best about the handle:<br />1. Convenient place for me to put rest my index finger during a shave. Also, I use that finger to add a little leverage/pressure as I shave down my face. This is a nice feature for me.<br /><br />2. Size/Weight: The battery adds a little, but I like the weight and feel of the handle in my hand. The handle is a little chunky, not bad for me since I'm XL, but keep in mind if you have small hands.<br /><br />3. Look/style: It looks stylish. I thought the feeling would pass after my first shave, but the handle just plain looks cool.<br /><br />Here's why it's not perfect:<br />1. The rubber pieces on the handle are a little slippery for wet hands. This isn't a huge deal once you're aware of it, but remember the device vibrates. During my 2nd shave the razor slipped out of my hands once. Every time I shave I notice that it's a little slippery. It seems like Gillette could probably have come out with something to add a little more grip.<br />2. This is personal prefernce, but I don't love the tingly feeling of the handle in my hand. Tough too complain about this since I like the blade vibration on my face way more than I dislike the handle vibration. I'm getting used to it though (and this is my first power blade).<br /><br />That's it. So should you get one? I would highly recommend. I've tried all of Gillette's manual razors and this is the best that's out there.

  1086. Thanks to Gillette, I received Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power Razor free in exchange for the testing and review. This review is for the handle only. Cartridges are not discussed here. I have been using Gillette Fusion Regular (non power) razor handle for the last 3 years and was excited to try the Power Handle. I tried other brands in the past and did not like them, so I am a firm believer that Gillette makes a good product. First impression - looks very nice, Power Handle is slightly bigger and thicker than regular one and blue light looks cool when you turn the handle on. Functionality - the light is covered up by your hand when you are shaving, so there is not much point to it rather than perhaps looking cool and possibly draining a battery faster. I only used the Power Handle 8 times now and the battery power does seem to hold good so far (battery does not feel drained). At first vibrations feel strange when you are shaving, but you get used to it very fast and I think it makes the shaving go a little faster. Bigger power handle is nicer in my opinion compared to the smaller regular handle, however I do not like the grip on the power handle. Regular handle has rubber part all the way to the top, and Power handle does not. Power handle has plain plastic where I place my index finger when holding the razor for a close shave. In my opinion the rubber piece on top side should be bigger. Regular Handle provides better grip, but Power Handle is easier to hold. If you have big hands - you should like Power Handle more. It also seems that power handle has slightly better angle than regular one. Overall great product, but not much better than regular, and I expected better. Regarding the shave - honestly both Gillette Fusion Razors, Power and Regular, provide great shave and it is hard to see the difference. I like Gillette razors, but see no major difference between the shave you get based on the handle. Cartridges is what makes a difference in a shave in my opinion, not the handle. I would have to point out that due to the vibrations of the power handle I find it easier to rinse and I think it washes out cleaner than the regular handle because of the vibrations. Overall - another great product from Gillette, better than other brands, bigger size is a step up and vibrations make it easier to clean. Yes I would recommend Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power handle. If the price is not much more than regular handle definitely go for it!

  1091. [DISCLOSURE] I received this razor free through a program from Gillette. I am generally an electric user - I last used a blade back in the days when 3 blades was considered extreme. Razor technology seems to have come a long way. 5 blades does shave faster than 3, and the vibration gives it a soothing feel. (I'm not sure it buys you much as far as a closer shave.) In general I still prefer an electric. I just cut myself too often with a blade. Maybe I'm just a klutz. Still, for the price difference between this and an electric, the shave is comparable.<br /><br />I did have one big gripe with it, however. I found the handle to be quite anti-ergonomic when holding the razor in a non-vertical position. For example, when shaving under my chin, the grip I used caused a fair bit of fatigue in my hand. Because of this, I would use this razor in a pinch, but likely would not make it my full-time shaver. The advantage of the vibration, for me, doesn't offset the need to make the handle so thick and stocky to accommodate the battery.
  1092. The grip on the handle works great for my bi-weekly shaving needs. I received this as a freebie from a program that Gillette is running. I am very grateful to have been included in the freebie program as I always wait for the last second to purchase my next batch of razors due to the costs. I also felt that my shave got closer with the capabilities of the powered function. It is a great product. Thank you Gillette.
  1093. Received the product from the Gillette Program for free. I really do enjoy the Gillette Fusion Proglide. The Power handle was really nifty and cool as well! It is one of the things that makes the overall product amazing. It has a slim neck with a nice and easy grip. It won't fall out of your hand as easily as other razors do. You put a few batteries inside and then twist it to close it. I trust that this is really tight and genius to help make the product waterproof. Turn the battery on and the handle vibrates a little, but the rubber gripping absorbs most of it so it will allow for a smooth shave. I was scared to try my first shave, but after the first stroke I had to continue. Really great!
  1094. First of all, I want to mention that I don't normally shave with a razor. I prefer to use an electric razor. However, when I received a free sample through Gillette, I figured that it was worth giving manual razors another shot. After using this razor for the past few weeks, I can honestly say that I like it a lot and will continue to use it.<br /><br />The first thing you'll notice about this razor is the high quality design. The handle is much thicker than the standard disposable razor, which makes it easier to grip. The handle also has a generous rubber grip around the handle and another rubber grip area near the razor itself where you can rest your thumb or index finger depending on how you are holding the handle. The handle has a power button that makes the razor vibrate gently while you're shaving. The vibration reduces the friction when you shave. I've been using my razor almost every day for the past few weeks and still haven't had to change the battery.<br /><br />As for the razor itself, it does what it's supposed to do. It provides a clean shave without irritating your skin. This has been a problem for me when I've used other razors, which is one of the main reasons why I switched to an electric razor. I also don't like to use shaving cream since I keep a mustache and goatee. I really just shave to clean up the areas around my facial hair. I just applied a little bit of soap to the areas that I needed to shave, and that was all I needed to get a nice clean shave.<br /><br />Overall, I'd highly recommend this razor especially if you've been having trouble finding one that provides a clean, comfortable shave.
  1095. I got the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power Handle free through a program run by Gillette. The ergonomic handle is the perfect size for your hand and helps you get the perfect shave. Even after getting the Power Handle wet, I had no problems with this razor. The grips on the razor are helpful and allow for precision shaving with no worry of dropping or fumbling around with the sharp blades.<br /><br />Speaking of which, the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power Handle gave me one of the best shaves I have ever had! It allowed for a quick, easy, and smooth shave, which was very satisfying because I am not always able to get the smoothest of shaves. The Power Handles came through though. This is a razor I can see myself purchasing in the future. If there was one problem with this razor, it'd be that it didn't come with any refills. Great shave.
  1096. I obtained a free razor via a program run by Gillette and was surprised by its size. It has a battery in it so expect it to be larger than your average razor. That being said, the grip was a comfortable and shaped ergonomically. The overall shave was good but I could have done without the micropulse feature as I did not get the sense that it gave a smoother shave with it on or off. Overall, a good razor at an expensive price.
  1097. The ProGlide Power handle is comfortable to use--way better than disposables. The bumps and rubberized ridges help you keep a grip when your hands are wet/oily/full of shaving cream. The vibration seems to help any level of compatible cartridge (i.e., no need to always get the super-premium proglide carts) give you a closer, more comfortable shave. The (included) AAA battery powering that handle lasts for a VERY long time... easily more than 6 months.<br /><br />I'd highly recommend this handle if you're a Gillette user.<br /><br />Full disclosure: I received a free razor through a program from Gillette, but I was already a loyal user and already had a Proglide power handle for months before.
  1098. I received a free Gillette Fusion Proglide Power Razor through BzzAgent to test and review. My normal razor is the Schick Hydro 5. To test the Gillette Fusion Proglide Power Razor, I put a new blade in each of the two razors and proceeded to shave the left half of my face with the Gillette Fusion Proglide Power Razor and the right side with the Schick Hydro 5.<br /><br />The test platform is my face. I grow thick hair quickly. I also do not shave daily. Thus, the hair in the test ranged in length from approximately 1/8 inch to 1/4 inch. While shaving, I made sure no other members of the household could see which side of my face was shaved with the Gillette and which side was shaved with the Schick.<br /><br />After each shave, my wife and 9 year old son would feel my face and tell me which side they thought was smoother. After a half dozen shaves, the conclusion was that the Gillette gave a slightly better shave, but it was close enough that if I had not shaven half of my face with each razor, no one could have noticed a difference. It really required a side by side comparison.<br /><br />The biggest problem I have had with razors in general is that they quickly become clogged, preventing the blades from cutting any more hair. Both razors passed the hair out the back of the razor with no problems.<br /><br />The Gillette Fusion Proglide Power Razor also has a vibrating feature that I used on every shave. My first instinct was that vibrating a razor at my thoat was a bad idea, but it turns out that I didn't get any more nicks or cuts with the Gillette than I did with the Schick. They both shaved close with almost no nicks.<br /><br />For shaving comfort, the Gillette Fusion Proglide Power Razor lost out to the Schick Hydro 5. The vibration of the Gillette made shaving feel like running in sand. It felt like the blades would cut half way through the hair, and then pull back before cutting the rest of the way through the hair. This made shaving with the Gillette take twice as long as with the Schick.<br /><br />All in all, if I needed a razor, and I couldn't get my regular Schick, I wouldn't feel bad in buying a Gillette Fusion Proglide Power Razor, but it would definitely be a second choice.
  1099. I only use electric razors because i have extremely sensitive skin and razors irritate it very much. This Gillett Fusion proglide was very impressive. It provided a close, smooth shave with no nicks, or razor burn, or irritation. It also felt comfortable to hold. I was very impressed with this razor and highly recommend it
  1100. This is coming from a lifetime G user! Best thing they ever did was to send a free one in the mail when I turned 18. Anyways I often feel that if you like what you use then use what you like.. why change?? However I recently had the option to try this over the first generation one I had been using for years.. I received the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power Razor for FREE via a program run by Gillette. It indeed makes it better, a closer, a more comfortable, and quicker shave!! simply amazing!!   1101. To be clear, I was offered a Fusion ProGlide to test by Gillette. My normal razor is an Edwin Jagger safety razor. Which leads us to my first point: The blades for the Fusion ProGlide are around 4 bucks each. With my safety razor, I can get 10 Feather blades for about the same price. The Fusion boasts 5 blades, and they tout them as being narrower than others, with a coating designed to cause less \\"tug and pull\\". I would think that any adequately sharpened blade would also prevent \\"tug and pull\\". The handle takes an AAA battery, which causes the handle to vibrate. It also increases profits for Duracell, Gillettes sister company. If it sounds daunting to place 5 vibrating razor blades onto your face, relax. The vibration isn't really noticeable, and I'm not sure that it's even a benefit, judging from the closeness of the shave, and the United States court system, which judged Gillettes claims about the razor to be \\"unsubstantiated and innaccurate\\". It seems gimmicky to me. I have an extremely coarse beard, and spent years searching for a close, comfortable shave. I ended up with the shaving kit that our grandfathers used. My single blade, double edged safety razor doesn't clog, and I normally shave every other day. The 5 blades DID clog with my coarse hair. I have no patience for that. The accompanying literature says that the built-in \\"guide comb\\" directs hairs into the blades, at the \\"optimum angle\\" for cutting. I don't know what the optimum angle is, but I have trouble believing that every hair requires the same angle for a smooth cut, given that I have to shave in several directions. Maybe I'm wrong. There's a trimmer on the back that I don't use. It gives a close enough shave when new, but the clogging was a deal breaker for me. I'm spoiled with a single blade that rinses out with ease. The vibrating handle? Meh. Call me a luddite, but I don't need gimmicky tech in a razor. I need a comfortable handle and a sharp blade. The Fusion handle IS comfortable and sturdy, but not as sturdy as my brass and chrome standby, I'd bet. All in all, it's a fine razor, but the cost of blades and all of the unnecessary bells and whistles make it seem a bit silly to me. And the shave? My Edwin Jagger still shaves closer.y, but not as sturdy as my brass and chrome standby, I'd bet. All in all, it's a fine razor, but the cost of blades and all of the unnecessary bells and whistles make it seem a bit silly to me. And the shave? My Edwin Jagger still shaves closer.
  1102. I was given the opportunity to try this product through Gillette. I really enjoyed the experience. I have previously used the Gillette Fusion Manual razor and though I was suspect, I did notice a difference when using the power model. It feels as though there is less drag so shaving is faster and somewhat more effortless. If there's any hygienic task worse than shaving, I've yet to find it, so anything that makes it easier is well worth the added expensive in my opinion.

  1105. Having been avid user of the Gillette Fusion Razor for the past three years, I didn't think there was going to be much difference when I picked up the Gillette Fusion Proglide Power Razor, which I received for free via a program run by Gillette. Boy, was I wrong. I have extremely sensitive skin and suffer from the dreaded razor burn and bumps when a blade gets used for more than 2 weeks. I have had the same blade on this razor for almost 4 weeks now and I am happy to report no razor burn or bumps! It's a miracle! Although I am not sure why, I have noticed that the lotion strip on the blade has not faded to white as it typically does with the regular Gillette Fusion Razor blades. That was always a clear indication that I would be shaving at my own risk if I did not change the blade. The power feature wasn't something that I was all that excited about but have grown to love. The gentle vibration must do something to help reduce the risk of razor burn and bumps.<br /><br />I would highly recommend this razor to others (and have done so already). Especially if you have sensitive skin. The only thing I miss from the regular Gillette Fusion Razor is the extra blade on the back for trimming your sideburns. And if that is the only downfall I am happy to sacrifice that extra blade for a consistently smooth and non-irritated post-shave glow. Definitely going to continue using this razor as although the blades are slightly more expensive than its predecessors, they last a LONG time. Glad I took a chance and made the switch.

  1108. In general, my skin is a bit sensitive and my whiskers quite rough (especially the greys). Even when I was younger I have never been able to shave with a single blade razor. They have been a godsend.<br /><br />Recently through a Gillette program I was given the opportunity to try the Gillette Fusion Proglide Power Razor. I can say without bias that the Proglide Power is easily the closest shave and most comfortable I've ever received from a handheld replacement razor system. The razor itself matches the best of other products I've used and the other features (Lubrastrip, Blade stabilizer) work well. But for me it is clear the micro-pulses/vibration that the razor has works wonders on getting a super-easy and close shave. In whatever way it works, IT WORKS! I really didn't expect any significant difference, but after using it and then going back to other manual shavers, the difference is noticeable. I encourage everyone to give it a go. At least for my particular needs, this is now my standard shaver and I can't imagine any significant improvements (although I'm always game for upgrades).

  1112. Gillette recently sent me a sample of the fusion proglide to replace my existing razor. As soon as I opened the box I saw that there was a battery for my handle. I have never had a powered handle for a non-electric razor before. I was quite skeptical at first but after a week of use I am no longer a skeptic, but a proglide believer. Unfortunately the box does not do justice with explaining the function of the powered handle. I had to hop online to figure out why the handle needed a battery. The battery gives a micro pulse that allows for the razor to cut with barely any sensation that the blades are touching the skin. I was amazed that the handle has a microchip which ensures that the same amount of power will be delivered and not taper off as the battery is dying as my electric razor use to do which resulted in painful shaves as the hair would get caught in the blade. The low battery light easily tells you when you will need to replace the battery. The best thing about the handle is the large grip that gives you good control of the shave and does not feel like it will fall apart after a few use. This thing is built to last! I am glad to replace my old razor with this!

The blade cartridges loaded and unloaded with ease, and the battery powered handle provided a smoother than normal shave that was nick, cut, and razor burn free; compared to a non-battery powered shaver handle. I like the battery power light that provided indication of when the handle was on or off, and whether the battery powewas low. Overall I am very pleased with this product and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.
  1142. Thanks to a program run by Gillette, I had the opportunity to try out the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power razor. This review is specifically for the handle, which I was pretty impressed with. I was a fairly skeptical of the 'power' aspect of this razor, thinking the vibration was more of a gimmick than anything else, but turns out I was wrong. The gentle vibration and micropulses definitely added to the overall closeness and smoothness of my daily shave. I handle was big & 'grippy' enough to handle while wet. I would absolutely buy this product.
  1143. a couple weeks ago I received the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power handle via a program run by Gillette. I have used the regular Fusion blades for quite some time and also had the opportunity to try another Gillette product, the Fusion Power Trimmer. As expected, this product offered the same, if not better, smooth shave. I'd say that I was satisfied and certainly not disappointed. That the battery is replaceable is a definite plus.
  1144. Before I start, I do have to provide the disclosure that this razor was provided via a program run by Gillette at no charge to myself. Now that we have that out of the way let's talk about my new Proglide Power Razor. Before I received this razor I was using an M5 Magnum 5 blade razor. I had no problems with that razor but felt I would give the Proglide a try.<br /><br />My first impression on the razor is that it's a nice look. How important is the look of a razor? None really, but I felt it was worth mentioning. The packaging is nice and I found that it opened easily. No wrestling with the plastic and almost severing a finger, a huge plus in my mind! It comes in a really nice hard case which you can set the blade on to. This will be nice if I wanted to take the razor with me when travelling. Weighing the alternative of just throwing the razor in a shaving bag, I feel this provides a little more protection from the blade snapping off or any other issues I may have.<br /><br />The one question I think you guys all are dying to know the answer to ... 5 blades? Really? Is that necessary?! Unfortunately I don't have an answer. Is 3 blades enough? 4? 5? Where does it end? The razor does give a great shave so I'm going to guess 5 blades is a good thing. I slack on shaving more than I should so when I do get around to shaving it's a bit more difficult and rough than it should be. One thing that really helps is the conditioning strip on the blade itself. After 6 shaves the strip still looks pretty good. I don't know how many shaves the strip should last and I will assume it's going to be different for every person but I'm happy to report that it's still holding strong.<br /><br />The next question you have (now that I've answered the blade question) is if the \\"power\\" part of the razor is needed. I'll admit that it does look nice when you press the power button on the handle and does light up a very nice blue! Other than that I don't see a need. I did an experiment where I shaved half my face with the power on and the other half with the power off. I didn't notice any difference in the ease of shaving or the smoothness of the shave. There's a chance it could make more of a difference when the blade becomes a bit more used but I'm not that far into using it to know if that is a true statement. The handle itself does have a good look to it though and it felt comfortable in my hands. It didn't feel like the razor was going to slip out of my hand or that I was going to drop it.<br /><br />Would I recommend this razor? Sure! It's a great razor. I am going to assume it works better than the 1-4 blade razors as there's no other reason they would add the coveted 5th blade! Based on pricing on razors I would say that this fits right in. It's not a cheap razor but not at the high end either. It's a great razor for people who want to spend a little more on a razor without breaking the bank.
  1145. I received the Fusion ProGlide handle as a free sample from Gillette. After just one use I immediate realized that I was getting a much closer shave than my previous razor. This was evident from the smoothness of my skin after my shave as well as the absence of my usual shadow at the end of the day. It's important to note that I was using a new Gillete Fusion ProGlide blade on my previous razor as well so I'm fairly confident this improvement was from the power handle itself. What I also liked about the power handle is that it has a slightly larger grip to accomodate the battery. This causes the razor handle to fit my hand more tightly which accomodates a much more controlled shave. Overall this is a great little device. This is particularly true if you, or your spouse, is a gadget friendly guy like myself.
  1146. OK, this seemed a little weird to have a razor handle that vibrates. This razor was provide free to me to try as a part of a program run by Gillette.<br /><br />It took a few strokes to get comfortable with the feel of the razor handle vibrating in my hand. I wasn't sold on the idea until I finished shaving and splashed water on my face to rinse. I immediately noticed that my skin was absolutely smooth with no sign of any stubble. I've been using this razor now for two weeks and I am still impressed by how comfortable it is to use with no drag or pulling. This is my new razor!
  1147. I was given the opportunity to test the new Fusion Proglide Power Handle along with the Proglide Power Blade. The blade seemed about on par with most other top of the line blades, however when combined with the Power Handle, something happens... something good.<br /><br />I have to say, I was VERY skeptical of the \\"Power Handle\\". I mean, what is a little vibration really going to do for your shave? The answer is, a lot. I still have no clue what is actually going on that makes this system work but I have not had a CUT FREE shave in years. I shaved off about a weeks worth of growth in a few passes, used the same old shave gel I always use, and viola, NO CUTS, NO RAZOR BURN and I think it even went faster than my usual shave.<br /><br />I don't skimp on razor blades, I use fresh, top-of-the-line blades and power-less handles, but apparently I have been buying the wrong ones. This FAR out performs my setup. I am convinced.
  1148. I received the Fusion ProGlibe for free through a program run by Gillette. I've never owned a battery operated razor in my entire life, believe it or not, so this was a unique opportunity for me to try this out. I appreciated the handle and how it didn't slip out of my hand in the shower while my hands were wet. The button that turns the razor on and off was easy to use, even with my oversized fingers! The compartment that houses the batteries was easy to open and close thereby making it easy to replace them when necessary as well.<br /><br />As far as the shaving went, I was very pleased with the performance of the razor. I had no pulling or nicks and this was with 5 days of growth - I had decided to really grow my hair out to give it a good test! It gave me a very close shave, there was no stubble when I was finished. Overall, I'm very pleased with the razor and the results that I received.
  1149. I don't know why, but my face hates crappy razors. I used to use this product (or the last version of this product maybe? They used to be all orange and no blue) for a long time and had no issues with it. Then my gf, being a loving and caring gf, tossed it out one day and bought me a new razor. One with only 3 blades. 3 tugging, pulling, excruciating blades.<br /><br />Well I saw this was an add on so I bought it to go along with another item that I actually wanted to order and I'm glad I did. I love this razor and while I'm sure practically no one will read this, I wanted to add my 5-star rating to the other 5-star ratings.<br /><br />Anywho, a quick pros and cons.<br /><br />Pros<br />1. 5 really thin blades means it takes less swipes to get the same closeness that half a dozen (or more) swipes on my last razor failed to get. More smooth, less razor burn for me.<br /><br />2. The \\"moisture pad\\" on it actually lasts longer than 2-3 shaves. Something I've vehemently hated about all other razors is that little strip gets used after like one shave. Are you kidding me? These don't last overly long, but it's way longer than most of its competition.<br /><br />3. There is way less \\"tug and pull\\" with this razor. The 5 blades seem to do really well at hacking the hair to pieces before it has a chance to tug. It really is the most comfortable shave I've been able to find using a manual razor.<br /><br />Cons<br />1. Refills for this thing are freaking expensive. I don't grow facial hair that fast, so it takes me a long time to get through a razor (I only shave 2-3 times a week since I have the gift of a baby face). But people who grow the Amazon jungle on their face every day will probably have to shell out a lot of money every year for refills.<br /><br />2. The Power option is kind of gimmicky. I've used it a few times and really didn't feel like there was much of a difference with the shave. This feature is probably for the aforementioned \\"burly\\" men above who grow whole fields of hair on their face every day. For the baby face like me who takes half a week to grow a 5 oclock shadow, the power option is pretty much useless.<br /><br />However, I have been using this razor for a long time and I do love it. I can't rave enough about how disposables and inferior razors tear my face apart. Last week was my last shave with the \\"crappy\\" razors and I cut myself 4 times. That's literally the damage I'll do with this razor in a full year. It's very high quality and works very well, especially for pansy faces like mine (darn sensitive skin). I would recommend this to anyone.
  1150. I grow some pretty thick facial hair, so I'm always looking for something that gives me a close shave. I've been trying different razors and I really enjoy this one. The handle has a great grip to it. I also enjoy the micropulses. One of the best razors I've used! I received this free razor, it was provided via a program run by Gillette.

  1160. In the interest of full disclosure, the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power handle was given to me by a Gillette-run program. I have used Gillette products for 40 years so I was anxious to try it. I have used this handle for 3 weeks. It has a battery that vibrates the handle. This is the first handle I have owned that requires a battery. FIRST IMPRESSION - I remember that I was surprised that the handle was very light, even with the battery installed. Very comfortable to hold. OVERALL - I really like the handle. I don't know how long the battery will last, but I liked the feel of the vibration as I shaved. Does it really make a difference? Can't say for sure but it seemed like it helps. I checked prices at a few stores and found that this product is comparable to other brands for similar features so it is not cheap. Since I have to shave every day, I don't mind spending what it takes to get a great shave.
  1161. I recently obtained a Gillette Fusion ProGlide razor via a program run by Gillette. I have since shaved with it a number of times and was impressed with how easily this razor does slide right across my face. I'm sure that will change as the blade gets older and duller, but right out of the package this razor provides an easy shave. It takes a lot less effort to shave my face now compared to the disposable razor I was using before I got my Fusion ProGlide.<br /><br />As for the handle itself, it has a sharp appearance and I like how it has a substantial size to it. When gripped by the black rubber portion that circles around the top, sides and back just below the neck of the razor, the razor fits firmly in my hand.<br /><br />The problem for me arises when I hold it by the lower part of the handle. Although I start my shave holding it near the top of the handle, I find that over the course of the shave, I wind up holding the handle lower over time. Perhaps that is due to shaving different parts of my face in order each time and holding it differently as I go through the process? I don't know for certain. What I do know is that the razor almost slides out of my hand when I hold it lower because there is no black rubbery grip on the top part of the lowest part of the handle. There is on the bottom, however, which doesn't seem to do any good. The same rubber that outlines the word \\"PROGLIDE\\" on the razor's underside should also outline the word \\"Gillette\\" on its top side. I don't know if the omission of the rubber was a decision based on aesthetics or what, but I could use that extra rubber grip area when trying to finish my shave.<br /><br />The problematic lowest part of the handle is also where the battery is loaded to allow for the Micropulse action. While the blue light that lights up when the button is pushed up looks cool, I don't think the Micropulses actually enhance the shave itself in any way. I think I even remember a lawsuit from a decade or so ago in whichone of the big razor companies (maybe even Gillette) got slapped on the hand for claiming that these vibrating razors helped a person get a better shave by stimulating the hairs to stand up. That was rightfully declared wishful thinking by the court, so I'm surprised to see products like this persisting in 2013.<br /><br />In the interest of my overall shave, I'd prefer that companies like Gillette focus on practical innovations like making blades that last longer instead of trying to distract me with a bright light and a buzzing razor.
  1162. This razor is by far the best razor I have used in years! Everyone buy one. You'll be very happy
  1163. I recently received the latest Gilette Fusion Proglide Power for free through a program with Gillette and was pleasantly surprised with the quality after being a longtime user of the Mach 3. The Proglide has a nice sturdy grip that can be held comfortably and the vibration allows for an easy and clean shave. The only criticism I would have is that it doesn't quite match the precision of the Mach 3, however, it's superiority in other categories far outweighs this. Definitely recommend.
  1164. I got the product as a free promotion from Gillette. At first I thought the vibrating was a gimmick. I enjoyed it once I tried it though.   1165. I received a free razor provided via a program run by Gillette. The razor handle itself is very comfortable to hold. The 5 blade head, although rather large, gave an incredibly smooth shave. Skin was soft with no cuts or nicks. When I turned the razor on (vibration) and shaved, it seemed to pinch while shaving. Definitely was better when used in the \\"off\\" position. I have a mustache and shaving close to the mustache is rather hard due to larger razor head. It's tough to see where you're cutting when you get close to the edge of the mustache. In larger areas on the face, the razor did fantastic. It did not clog and rinsed out with ease. I didn't believe the claim that it was waterproof in the shower, so I tested it, and it DEFINITELY is!
  1166. The Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power Handle is designed specifically to fit the curve of a palm. It also has grips designed to keep the handle in place even under water to prevent slippage. A secure seal on the battery compartment helps prevent battery corrosion. The only down-side I found was that the power button was not located in the most intuitive place. It would make more sense to have the button where the thumb ends up when gripping the handle.
  1167. I was lucky enough to receive a Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power Razor through a program offered from Gillette and am glad I did. Although the blades are expensive, I have a hard time going back to my other 5 blade razor. The Gillette is sometimes not the most comfortable shave (especially when the blades begin to dull) but it is always the closest. In fact even when the blades are dull, I have kept it in my shower just to clean up my face after using a different razor my wife bought me. Even she can tell the difference in the closeness of the shave. I also love the way the razor fits in my hand. A lot of times with other razors, I catch myself pressing way too hard on my face as I use it but the Power ProGlide doesn't make me do it. The razor glides right over my face with minimal effort (especially when using a good gel shaving cream). It has eliminated the razor burn and irritation I have had with my previous blade. I also love the small vibration that the handle provides. It seems to help cut my beard easier when it has grown a little longer. I am a daily shaver because of my job but if I ever miss a day, I have to use the Power ProGlide because it just works so much better.
  1168. I have used this for several weeks now and the blade work great as Gillette always does. The power portion of the razor has a nifty blue led light when you turn it on. Can't really tell the difference between the powered version and the regular razor. Overall good clean close shave.
  1169. Note: Free Razor Provided By Gillette Program.<br /><br />I have experimented over the years with a number of different shaving products, as my wife is not accepting of the slightest bit of facial hair. Naturally, I want the shave to be as comfortable as possible. For years I have \\"chased the blades\\" - buying anything that had a 1 plus on the previous number, which has been stuck at 5 for a while now. For the most part (once the first two shaves are out of the way) the top shelf 5 blade razors perform the same over time, so let me focus on the power handle.<br /><br />The first thing I noticed is that the handle is thicker with a beefy rubber grip. That's a substantial improvement over the thinner handles as there is less slippage in the shower. However, I don't think the power vibration feature added much if anything to the experience, and the vibration is really uncomfortable on my upper lip, so I end up turning it off before shaving that area. Not everyone will experience the odd discomfort I did.<br /><br />Basically, the quality of the shave was similar, if not identical to the non-powered 5 blade varieties (Gillette Fusion or Schick Hydro). That, coupled with the fact that I cannot use the power feature while shaving the mustache area makes me lean toward the non-powered varieties for the future as they cost less.
  1170. I have sensitive skin, and have endlessly been searching for a razor that will not only give me a nice close shave, but one that also won't irritate my skin after shaving. I've been a fan of the standard Gillette Fusion ProGlide razors for some time, and when I got the opportunity to try the Fusion ProGlide Power handle through a program run by Gillette, I jumped at the opportunity.<br /><br />I was already pretty happy with the Fusion ProGlide razor, and was interested to learn what the Fusion ProGlide Power handle would add to the experience. I found that the thinner/finer blades, combined with the larger lubricating strip, plus the micropulses provided by the Power handle definitely do seem to give me a closer shave with less irritation.<br /><br />Pros:<br />* thinner blades and larger lubricated strip definitely reduce friction<br />* precision trimmer blade is awesome for squaring off & trimming sideburns, and under my nose<br />* closer shave than previous Fusion models<br /><br />Cons:<br />* longer hair tends to get caught in cartridge a bit<br />* \\"improved blade suspension\\" actually seems to restrict the swiveling movement of the cartridge a bit, compared to previous incarnations of the product.<br /><br />All in all, the Pros far outweigh the Cons, and this is easily my favorite razor that I've ever used....and I've tried almost all of them. It's superior to the other multi-blade razors in its class, and with the month-long life of the edge of the blades, the impact on your wallet is greatly lessened as well. Highly recommended.
  1171. I received a sample of the ProGlide Power Razor through a promotional campaign by Gillette. I was definitely not thrilled with the razor over all.   1173. After years of using a 3 blade razor I was eager to try the Gillette Fusion ProGlide.<br /><br />I used the razor everyday for one week.   1183. Very good razor, I will be buying more blades and making this my permanent razor. Weight is evenly balanced with a solid grip and provides a clean quick shave. I highly recommend.
  1184. While I usually buy most of my grooming supplies from Amazon, I was lucky enough to be a part of a promotional program by Gillette and received one of these razors for free in the mail. At first I thought that adding a battery powered handle was just some gimmick, suffice to say it did make a difference in the how the shave felt. Now I have very thick coarse hair that grows quite quickly and sensitive skin so finding a comfortable shave can be a challenge. I have always had good luck with Gillette's blades and this one did not disappoint.<br /><br />When it came to the powered handle I decided that I would do a little experiment. First I did a normal shave without turning on the handle to get a sense of how well the razor worked with just the blades. The blades themselves are very comfortable and provide an extremely close shave. The next day I repeated the process this time with the handle turned on. While there was no perceivable difference in the quality of the shave, though the level of comfort from the handle was noticeable. Impressed with how well the shave felt I decided to see how well it could cope when I took a few days off from shaving. I went without shaving for 3 days to make sure I had a pretty good amount of hair grown out. I then shaved with the handle turned off and can say I was thoroughly impressed with the quality of the blades, there was no pulling and my skin was baby smooth with minimal irritation. I then grew the hair out again for 3 days and tried again this time with the handle turned on. If I had to ding the product it would be here, it was not as comfortable with the handle on when shaving the much longer hair. During the shave the vibrations would cause the razor to occasionally pull on some of the hairs, though this was still more comfortable than shaving this length with the Mach 3 series of blades. Since the shave is so comfortable, I am finding that I am currently shaving everyday so this is not a problem.
  1185. Received this razor in a program by Gilette. I tried this product for the first time this week and I was very surprised. I usually stick with the standard non battery operated razor or an electric razor and alternate between both. I picked this razor up last week and noticed a big difference in the closeness of the shave and the smoothness of my skin vs. my old razors. Very nice. Some people say the battery is a gimmick and so are the 5 blades on the razor. I feel these both really add to the experience and really provide a great shave. The lubricating strip on the razor also leaves your skin very smooth as well. Great product.

One drawback I did find about this handle was it felt a little bit lighter than previous models I have used; some people may like this lightweight feel, while I personally like a razor that feels a little heavier in my hand.   1217. I have very sensitive skin and have used a Gillette Fusion manual razor for years with much satisfaction. When the Fusion Proglide Power razor came I out I was initially very skeptical. First of all what could a vibrating razor really do besides make your girlfriend happy, with the close shave you'll get, of course. Secondly I am already getting a great shave with my manual razor, how could this be an improvement? Well I received the opportunity to try the razor for free thanks to Gillette and I'm surprised to say that I am glad I did.<br /><br />Even with the Fusion manual razor, I would still get some razor burn if I shaved two days in a row, but the Fusion Proglide Power razor gives an unbelievably close and enjoyable shave, even in that circumstance. The reason for this, in my opinion, is that the vibration from the razor slightly desensitizes your skin while you shave and adjusts for any small inconsistencies in the contact between your face and the razor as the blade moves along your skin, which would otherwise result in a knick. The only cons with the razor are that the vibration from the razor takes a little getting used to and can be awkward in your hand at first, and I would prefer it be rechargeable instead of requiring a AAA battery.<br /><br />In conclusion I would definitely recommend the small investment in upgrading from a manual razor to a Gillette Proglide Power razor. The vibration will give you a smoother closer shave and your girlfriend will love it, your closer shave I mean, plus it's waterproof! And don't worry, the regular Gillette Fusion cartridges will work with your new razor, just as well as the custom Proglide Power cartridges, in my opinion, which will save you a little dough!

  1220. I've been using razors for 25 years now, and I've tried a pretty good range of razors, from fancy razors down to the cheapo $1 razors.<br /><br />For the past 6 years I've been using mainly the Gillette Custom Plus razor, and have been satisfied with it. It's the no frills razor that my wife uses, and I have been going along for the ride. She buys the large 52 pack, making each razor about $0.65 - $0.75 each.<br /><br />I used those razors until the blue lubrication strip falls off, which turns out to be a few weeks. This was all about economy, and very little about the quality of the shave. Still, I was satisfied just the same.<br /><br />I had the opportunity to learn about a Gillette program to evaluate their new razor, They sent me the Fusion ProGlide Power for a free evaluation, and was predictably skeptical. I really believed that there wouldn't be any significant difference in the shave quality or the experience. All razors are more or less the same, right?<br />I was wrong.<br /><br />They sent me the Fusion ProGlide Power, and I popped in the included battery. At first I was a little hesitant about my razor actually vibrating on my face. I mean, I usually use gentle straight strokes, and don't wiggle the blade or anything.<br />I put it in the shower (I don't use a mirror, I feel around for the stubble. That's just my style.) and gave it a try.<br /><br />I had to laugh when I took the first stroke. It is SOO much better than the razors I had become accustomed to using. It's immediately smooth, solid in the hand, and effective. I could actually feel that my face felt different. I was totally stunned.<br /><br />Having used disposable razors for so long, I had forgotten what a difference a substantial handle makes in the shaving process. There's a little rubber pad near the head that is perfectly placed for your finger for added stability on the cheeks and such.<br /><br />I had thought the 5 thin blades were mostly marketing at work, but it's pretty obviousnow that Gillette has really tried to make the most effective tool for the job.<br /><br />One thing I noticed right away was that nothing was rattling or shaking around. There are no loose parts, it's just a very solid feeling in the hand, like you're using a very well crafted tool. I think this has to do with the wide flat design of the cartridge blade. It seems that if it were thin, like my usual razors, it would jiggle around more.<br /><br />This razor is truly excellent, so why haven't I been using a razor like this for the last ten years? Mainly the perception that it's expensive. This razor isn't particularly expensive, but the cartridges are, at least comparatively. Each cartridge is about five times the price of my usual economy blades. I'm not entirely sure how long they last, but even if they lasted twice as long, they would still be almost three times the price.<br /><br />But the reality is that the cost is minimal. It's probably less than $2 a week for an awesome shaving experience. (a $4 cartridge that lasts 2-3 weeks) I pay more for chewing gum, and don't enjoy it half as much.<br /><br />I hope this review helps you out.

  1235. At first I thought the &#34;power&#34; in this razor was just a gimmick. It very well may be part gimmick, but it actually works well. I owned a Mach 3 razor previous to this, tried the Schick Hydro 5, and briefly used the Gillette Fusion Proglide Manual, and what I came to realize, is that this razor gives me the closest shave in the easiest form. The power part causes the razor to vibrate and by doing so, allows the razor to cut hairs better than a regular manual razor would. I ended up seeing a much better shave with less irritation than any of the other razors I tried. I almost always use shaving gel before and lotion after I shave, but a few times I've been lazy and skipped them and the razor worked fine. Even without the gel or cream, I haven't experienced any tugging or pulling. I found that to be the most impressive part of the razor, and that's why I would recommend it. It's a little on the pricey end, with the replacement blades also not being any cheaper, but for the shave, i think it's worth it.

With the Fusion ProGlide Power handle, I found it easy to use in the shower thanks to the size/shape/construction. No slipping, no sliding, even with water and shaving cream on the handle. Then, if it's one of the days that I really want to be thorough I kick on the power feature and the pulsing action does a great job of eliminating the last traces of stubble without irritating my skin. I also like the fact that this handle is larger than many others, it seems to make it easier to control - not to mention easier to find when I can't remember where I left it!<br /><br />The best compliment I can offer is this - I received a sample of this product free via a program run by Gillette and it made me a believer. I ditched my old brand because this razor simply works. Yes, it's more expensive than many others, but the difference in quality is substantial and impressive. Right now, Amazon has a special offer for $3.00 off, so that pretty much zeros out the price difference with the cheaper (and less able) brands.
  1240. Loved the razor! It gave a comfortable shave that was effortless. Worth the money, but it is expensive! I would totally recommend it to anyone. A really good razor is hard to find and I think I may have found my favorite. The razor was provided via a program run by Gillette
  1241. I thought that a handle is basically...a handle on a razor. How can they be all that different. I received a free shaving razor and carts from Gillette through a program they are running at this time and used it for the first time this morning.<br />Usually I use an electric and at times a disaposable cheapy.<br />This handle is extremely well engineered and weighted perfectly for a clean and neat shave.   1252. Let me start with, I used a 2-blade manual before. I didn't know how a 5-blade razor, or even an electric razor would feel like.<br /><br />Basing this off of a 2-blade experience, this is amazing. Simply put, Gillette has done it. The downside, if I drop this in the sink or the bathtub, since its a reusable, you have to continue to use it. However, that's a problem all reusable razors face, so you can't blame Gillette for that.<br /><br />The grip is very soft and grippy, so I am not losing my grip on the razor in the middle of shaving. The electronic feature makes it seem like a massage, coming from a manual.<br /><br />Day 1: Heaven<br />Day 2: I am starting to notice the faults<br />Day 3: I feel like I can name a much needed change:<br /><br />Make the blade narrower, our faces are curved, not flat pieces of paper. When shaving more of the blade is not even being used. Only the center gets used the most, and thus, the blade wears out quickly. If the blade was smaller, maybe the prices of the blade refills would be less and then it would not be awkward to be paying only $1 more for the razor than a single blade.<br /><br />Also, maybe it was just me, but the blade included with this razor, provided free by a Gillete program, wore out very quickly, prompting me to have to make a quick stop the next day to my local Walgreens to pick up a refill cartridge. It was this that led me to deduct a star from the rating, and if the blade had lasted long, this would no doubt be a 5-star product.

The vibrations in the handle literally cause the blade to glide over your skin in a way I've never experienced.   1259. I received the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power Razor via a program run by Gillette.<br /><br />First, a few notes on the packaging - the back of the package is perforated, so it tears open easily - if you happen to notice it, that is. There's no \\"open here\\" arrow, so I was all ready to get the scissors to cut the top off, when I happened to pull on the back, and it tore off. How silly of Gillette not to draw attention to this. Also, the outside package is recyclable, but I didn't see any recycling arrow on the inner cradle, made of even thicker plastic. Boo!<br /><br />Now, to the handle itself. The best handle I've used is on the Schick Xtreme - curved, lots of ridges to get a good grip (especially when using in the shower), and a convenient indent towards the end where your thumb naturally goes. You won't find any of that on this Gillette razor - it's too straight, and not enough ridges on both sides to keep a good grip.<br /><br />The blade pivots enough, but doesn't seem to be in the right starting position (i.e. you always need to press and pivot the blade just to get started). If it sat at more of an angle, it would be better.<br /><br />Didn't notice that the vibration does anything useful. Seemed to get the same shave whether it was turned on or not.
