  1280. I received the Gillette Fusion Pro Glide Power Razor as part of a promotion run by Gillette.<br /><br />I like safety razors and have used the one I bought from Hoffritz for decades. As a result, I have a natural bias toward the traditional heavy metal type and consider most of the disposable razors on the market today as just cheap pieces of plastic which are better for women's legs and underarms than a man's beard.<br /><br />In the few instances in which I have had to use plastic razors I have found them to be poor and require me to go over the same spots, causing a rash or shaving burn. For this reason, I initially had some trepidation and built in bias against the razor. However, when I tried the Pro Glide Power Razor I was pleasantly surprised!<br /><br /> I like the design. It is very ergonomic and easy to grip. The weight is good as well, not too heavy or too light. I was impressed at the way the razor moved effortlessly over my face. In addition, the shave was very smooth, no nicks nor chafes which are so common with the traditional safety razor.<br /><br />While the shave was good, I experienced some tugging by the blade even when shaving a day old beard. Suffice to say when I tried it after not having shaved for a couple of days, it pulled and tugged even more. I also found that there was some difficulty shaving areas around my chin and under my bottom lip. I had to repeatedly go over these areas until they were smooth. In addition, because I have a clef chin, I was not able to shave that area effectively without going over the spot several times.<br /><br />I am not certain why the pulsation is necessary. The Pro Glide Power Razor shaves well enough without vibrating. I feel that this feature can be eliminated and it won't be to the Pro Glide's detriment.<br /><br />Since I do not normally use this type of razor, I cannot comment about the cost of replacement cartridges. However, I know it is far easier to find those items than for me to locate a conventional razor blade!<br /><br />I would definitely recommend this Pro Glide Power Razor, even for guys, who, like me still use the old fashion safety razor.

  1286. The bane of all men - shaving. I am cursed with what I call \\"sensitive skin\\". No matter the preparation or after-treatments, every time I shave my skin turns red and dries out under my eyes and on either side of my nose. Oddly, I am not even shaving that area - it seems to be a sympathy reaction. To adjust, I shave only 3 times every two weeks (about every 5 days). I am graced with an even distribution of facial hair so I can usually pull it off, even in an office setting. However, I would prefer the clean-shaven look, and I think I've finally found my answer.<br /><br />I have tried electric razors in the past, but they never shaved quite close enough. And more than once I've been subjected to 'razor burn' from these and it is not pleasant. So when I had the opportunity to try out the Gillette Fusion ProGlide I went into it assuming this would be another failure for me. Boy was I wrong. The micro-vibrations of the handle combined with the excellent replacement blades gave me the smoothest, most comfortable shave I've ever had - even week-old stubble. I only used hot water to prepare my face, so I can only imagine it being even easier with some regular preparation.<br /><br />The replaceable blades seem to last as long, if not longer, than comparable-priced manual razors. I tend to use my blades longer than most, trying to get the most for my money. The 'power' handle helps that process, allowing for a dull blade to easily cut through those whiskers.<br /><br />Downside - I still have an issue with the tight areas under my nose and around my sideburns. It does have a precision trimmer, but the size of the head just makes it too unwieldy to get into those tight places. I keep a standard 2-blade disposable close by for those really tight spots.<br /><br />I highly encourage you to try it, I think you'll be a convert right away!

  1297. I liked the product, but the vibration did irritate my skin at first. As I started using it regularly, I got used to it. The handle is a nice fit and weight in my hand, and it is easy to use in the shower. I received this razor through a program run by Gillette, but I would buy refills for this razor myself as needed.
  1298. First, let me say that I love Gillette and have been a loyal user since I started shaving 20 years ago. I really, really like the shave I get with their products, but feel like there's a shaving arms-race going on and Gillette is just continuously trying to one-up itself.<br /><br />I received the Proglide Power Handle and a free blade from Gillette as part of a promotional program. I was super excited to try the latest and greatest from the company. Having used this 4 times now, I'm feeling like this technological advance forward was 2 steps back for my neck.<br /><br />The handle feels great in your hand. Has a nice, balanced weight and feels like something sturdy that would give you a great shave. However trying to navigate it around your neck felt awkward, like you couldn't get the right amount of pressure on your neck.<br /><br />The \\"power\\" aspect of the handle is a real wild card. I tried shaving with the power on and then again with the power off, but ended up bleeding every time I used this product. I'm not sure if I got a bum cartridge with the handle or not - I was quite surprised (and disappointed) with these results.<br /><br />Overall, I can't recommend the power handle - but will keep using it to see if I get better performance after more practice.
  1299. This GILLETTE FUSION PROGLIDE POWER HANDLE product was sent free from Gillette. I was amazed of how great the product worked.. Very close shave and only shave once instead of going over and over the same area to get a good shave. Highly recommended.

The razor had a smooth glide over my skin (Fairly course stubble) and I noticed less \\"breakout\\" around my neck within the first week. I shaved everyday with the razor.   1325. I must first disclose that I received a free Gillette Fusion Proglide Power Razor free of charge from Gillette to write an honest non-bias review. I am an individual who HAS to shave every day for work, not because I like to, therefore I want to make sure that my shave is not only enjoyable, but fast and that it delivers a nice clean look without much hassle.<br /><br />When I first received my razor I opened the package, and followed the enclosed instructions to place the battery inside. The one thing that kind of did worry me off the bat is if I would be able to use this razor IN the shower, as nowhere on the instructions did it mention that it was safe. I figured why not and jumped in the shower with it.<br /><br />What makes this razor unique from others in the market is the handle. It is battery operated to offer a vibration sensation. This is suppose to assist in getting a closer shave. Personally I did not see a huge difference in my shave as opposed to using a regular Gillette Fusion Razor. The handle did provide a nice vibration, but to be honest, it made me fearful of cutting myself due to the slight vibrations it produces. At times it gave me the sensation of shaving with an electric razor, only because of the movement it was emitting.<br /><br />Once done, I was happy that I was not nicked anywhere and was very content with my shave. This handle offers a very soothing and different shaving experience than just a stand alone razor. Therefore, if your the kind of guy who likes to have the newest tech out there, i recommend this razor for you. But, if your just a simple joe like me and just want a fast and easy shave, I'd suggest to stick with a regular Gillette Fusion Razor. Gillette makes great razors, but the Fusion Proglide Power Razor is just not for me. I'll stick with my regular Gillette products.

  1327. It seems like razors are just one gimmick after another nowadays. You've got ones with 60 blades, that vibrate, wash your car, clean your room and might even shave your face. The Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power handle is no exception to this rule with both cartridges and a handle that is specially contoured and vibrates. Why do I need a vibrating razor? Why do I need a razor with contoured, ergonomic rubber sides?<br /><br />That question really couldn't be answered until my first actual shave with the razor. I was incredibly surprised with how balanced the handle was in my hand, and how easy it was to grip and slide the blades over my face. It was this light touch that allowed a close shave without hacking at my face and really digging into it. And as for the vibrating handle part? I was incredibly shocked that it actually did seem to bring the hairs on my face to the surface a bit more, and almost seemed to massage my skin as it shaved.<br /><br />I still think these types of razors are a bit overpriced, but I guess if you have to shave daily, and can find a great deal on them, it's a pretty sweet handle. I was fortunate enough to have mine given to me for free via a program run by Gillette, because I'm not quite sure I'd pay $10 for the handle and one cartridge, and then have to turn around and pay $32 (Amazon price) for a pack of 8 cartridges. That's an awful lot to spend on razors.
  1328. I was using the Gillette Mach 3 before... a good razor! The handle is much thicker than the standard disposable razor, which makes it easier to grip. The handle also has a generous rubber grip around the handle and another rubber grip area near the razor itself where you can rest your thumb or index finger depending on how you are holding the handle. I've been using my razor almost every day for the past few weeks and still haven't had to change the battery.

Overall, I think this is a great razor, with a comfortable handle, very smooth shave, and has sped up my mornings quite a bit as a result.
  1330. Shaving is never part of my \\"enjoy\\" list but it's a necessary evil. I usually use an electric razor to shave off the \\"steel wool\\" on my face but there will be times when a wet shave is required using a regular razor. I have thick hair that needs my complete attention whenever I shave because something will get snagged. It's not a pleasant experience to feel hairpulling on your face. I even had a barber shave my face in which he stated I had the toughest facial hair he has ever encountered. But the ProGlide definitely makes life so much easier for me. The finer blades help glide across my face without so much tugging. The Microcomb definitely helps against stray stubble. The indicator strip really lets you know when it's time to change the blade, which in my case isn't very often, thankfully. The handle grip is excellent and flexible. I don't find myself with any shaving cream residue residing on it.<br /><br />So with that said I wondered why it needed an upgrade with the new Power feature. This was a curious thing when I saw that a battery was included. The power button is on the handle so you are able to turn it on and off. The vibrating feature helps make your shaving experience much more relaxing. In addition it's also supposed to imitate what an electric shaver feels like against your face complete with the humming and noise. Quite honestly it didn't add anything to my experience. It's a strange thing to have on a straight edge razor like this.<br /><br />Overall, the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power Handle is great as a razor but doesn't need the extra vibrating feature to make the shaving experience beneficial. More than anything it becomes an annoying feature.
